name: amccombs42
text:
I read all the great reviews on this place and was very excited to come in and get a new hair/beard style for a friend's wedding.

When I arrived just after 1:30 PM on 9/2/2021 the shop was closed with no sign explaining why on the door. The hours listed on Google and on their own door said that should be open until 8 PM on Thursdays. Very disappointing. I was quite looking forward to the great service that I read about in the reviews.

name: Michael Douglas
text: I've been here twice the frist time was great!!  the second the guy left a line in my hair I wasnt pleased at all. Noted they were different people I did catch there names.

text:
Aretha is the best & so is Kent
Hands down

name: G Will
text: Aretha took very good care of me today, I really enjoyed the service and I have found my barber in my new home

name: Derrian Aguillon
text: Excellent experience! Was disappointed when I had called another barbershop and they told me to come in, only to tell me that they weren't cutting hair anymore. I came to Razors, and the lady in the first chair to the right was more than happy to take me, I didnt have to wait to long and she worked with my hair! Wish I remembered her name but I told her that this would be my shop for the remainder of my stay in Alabama.

name: Ciyeva Lafaye
text: Love coming here. Worth every penny

name: Rasheedah Heath
text: I've been taking my nephew to Fred since 2014.  Fred is always friendly and professional.  He's consistent  and does very good work. The atmosphere is nice and professional.  The shop is always clean, which to me is a plus.  I hate going into dirty establishments.   I highly recommend Fred and Razors Barber & Style Lounge.

name: Thomas Huffman
text: I was in a desperate need for a haircut when I was visiting a friend in Alabama. I spoke with Heather over the phone and within 5 minutes I felt very comfortable being there. The entire staff greeted me at the door immediately after I walked inside. The shop inside was extremely clean. I highly recommend coming here for a good quality haircut and great customer service from the staff.

name: Brandy McKenzie
text: I took my son here for the first time yeaterday and all I can say is I am VERY PLEASED my son said that Heather is now his A1 barber and she did beyond excellent. The barber shop is clean and everyone was professional. Heather we will be scheduling again!!! Great work!!

name: Ricky Tesch
text: I have been driving 8hour round trips back to Florida to get my haircut. I finally found Heather at Razors. I couldnt be happier. Not only was she amazing but she had personality. I will never let another person but her touch my hair again. Make an appointment quickly. They go fast.

name: Marquis Brown
text: Great barber shop and an awesome barber.  Enjoyed the atmosphere and the Mrs definitely approved of the cut.  I had been looking for a regular barber to shave my head and trim my beard for awhile.  Fate sent me to Courtney, a true professional.

name: Tyrell D
text: Came from Jacksonville Florida and found this barbershop on google and from the time I walked in it was an amazing experience the manager Fred introduced himself soon as I walked in. The dude that cut my hair was Jordan and he was 🔥🔥🔥🔥 good job Jordan I definitely will be coming back . I definitely will recommend this barbershop to anybody in the Hoover Alabama area 🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥

name: Bicker Alqaza
text: The best haircut I have received. Didnt know what kind of cut I wanted but Fred walked me through the different cuts he did and it came out amazing. Definitely looking forward to my next visit. 10 out of 10.

text: Andrew was very professional and talented when he cut my dad's hair. He paid attention to detail and listened to his concerns. He'll definitely be back!!

name: Brittany
text:
Edit: Reece gives an excellent haircut every time!! Definitely ask for her. (Thanks for the pixie cut, Reece, it's amazing!)

Don't know what's going on with the bad reviews, my boyfriend and I had a lovely experience here. We both got exactly what we wanted. I have short, shoulder-length, thick hair that's curly in some spots, wavy in others, and stick-straight in other spors. I've had SO many salons butcher it. I got a great haircut here and loved it! They weren't overly pushy about selling their products, either, like some salons can be. I was shocked at how cheap the cut was ($36 for shampoo, cut, and style), because I felt it was really good quality. Definitely give them a try!

text: Le was terrific! Yes, that's how she spells her name. I was dirty after work so I wanted a shampoo before my cut. name: Kizzie Gooden
text: Don’t really deserve a 1 Star....I went in after work (around 1:30pm) and the lady pretty much fussed at me for coming. She asked me what I was there for and I said a wash and style. Then she said you’re going to have to come back tomorrow morning because I’m the only one here and I have two before you. I’m thinking but you close at 7pm and only have two before me why do I have to come back tomorrow? So they lost a customer before they’ve had a chance to serve me. So, no, I won’t be back tomorrow or ever.

name: Tim Aldridge
text: Emily did a great job! I came in around 11am and there was no wait whatsoever. I see many posts from people saying there was only one person working when they came but there were 3 on while I was there. It appears the business has read these reviews and is staffing up to provide better service.

text: Marquita was super nice & did a great job!  Highly recommended!

name: Carol Adams
text: Worst cut EVER!  I was butchered by the middle-aged Asian woman at the Homewood (Edgemont Town Center) salon. All she had to do was follow the cut I had. Did not realize how bad it was until I got home and brushed it out. Cut is uneven and choppy. Could have done better myself with a blindfold and garden sheers. Turns out my mother had the same experience with the same "stylist." The woman should NOT be cutting hair. $27 for the cut and "style."  STAY AWAY from this place!

name: Katie Crandall
text: I went in during a weekday ( 9:45AM ) and there was only one male working. He noted it would be over an hour for a simple trim because “they only scheduled one person to work.” He did not offer any validation and continued with the person he was working with. Extremely poor customer service; this place doesn’t even deserve one star.

name: evildarklemons Dark
text:
PETITION TO FIRE THE OLD FOREIGN LADY!
Do not walk in! Dont even go near this place when the old foreign lady is working there. Ive told her 3 times i just wanted a specific trim and she did not follow directions i also told her and my mom also told her to do this and not do this. She wouldnt listen and just pointed to the picture right beside me and said "you want it like this" i said no and went over with her again to what i wanted. Well i simply wanted a trim and got 3.5 inches taken off me now. This is so frustrating! I see that im not the only victim to have there hair cut by this lady. She needs to be fired for this this is very bad customer service.

text: Had a great hair from Miss Lee. Will come back

name: Shelley Roman
text: Not a go to for color. I tried getting subtle highlights and I ended up with super blonde highlights on my brown hair! Was very embarrassed to walk out. Never again.

name: Caroline Wright
text: I went in for a simple "straight across the bottom trim", evening out the sides and back to chin length.  I came home with a disaster!  Lots of hair was missed in the cutting procedure and not only was it not even, it was jacked up shorter in the back than when I walked in.  I came home and cried.  I do not remember the Asian girls name who was asked to give me a simple trim but I know that it will take 2 months before someone else can fix it.  Wasted time, tears and $20. I would give ZERO stars if it were an option.

name: karen Edwards
text:
Update: The new manager was great and trying to improve things. She apologized for the poor job the lady did and refunded me. As far as I know the lady who did this hack job is still there. She was mad at. e, would not speak to me or apologize. She couldnt careless if you are happy with what she does to your head or not. I waited until the end of the year to get my hair fixed and wore it up the whole summer. My hair looks a million times better from a student at Aveda. Stay away from from the lady at this place who clearly has many of the same horrible reviews.
__________________________________________
If I could give this place 0 Stars I would. The lady who cut my hair decided to do her own thing and left big chunks, that she called layers, in my hair. The closest thing I can describe my hair in terms of what it looks like now is basically almost a mullet. I came in with really long hair with beautiful long blended layers that needed to be trimmed up and left looking like I fell on a weedeater. It looked horrible and she did not care and tried to charge me double. I immediately went to another salon for an opinion and they said I needed to go back and get my money back and the only way to correct it is to cut about 4 more inches off or keep it up until it grows out and I can get it cut again. Theres no way to blend with the hack job she did. She refused to be understanding and concerned about how I felt about my hair and was angry that I didn't like her "work of art" and that I wouldn't pay her double than what I asked for. Horrible experience. Do not go here.

name: Will Scogin
text: I specifically asked the lady to just trim my hair and keep the layers, and she ended up cutting 2-3 inches off. It was rough/looked awful. Just got it fixed at a different salon, and the new person was shocked at how uneven it was. I would NOT recommend going here!

name: Shyam Panthi
text: There is a vietnamese/filipino old lady "Vuong" who demands cash payments and does not give receipts. She is also very rude and does not know how to cut hair. She is probably pocketing all the cash without the knowledge of the owner. Worst place I ever had a hair cut. Would give a minus rating if possible. Please don't go here.

name: Scott Postin
text: If you value your hair then you need to stay away from this place. I went there on 3 different occasions and had my hair cut by 3 different people and each haircut got progressively worse. The last time I asked her 2 use a 1 guard on the back and the sides and a 2 on the top, simple right? Oh no, she used a 2 on the back and sides and a 4 on top. It looked horrible. Today I ended up going to Smart style salon in Wal-Mart on lakeshore just to get it fixed. DON'T GO TO HEADSTART!!!!!!!

text: I’ve been to several places around Birmingham but couldn’t find anyone who paid attention to the details I asked for in a haircut - they kind of cut it how they wanted. text: Holly has been cutting my hair since I moved to Birmingham two short years ago. Every time I leave her place, I roll out feeling confident and extremely satisfied. She gives one of the best bald fades I have ever experienced! If you are in the Birmingham area, I absolutely recommend this shop for all your barbering needs.

text: I have been with Holly for 4 years or so and I’ve never been disappointed a single time. Great atmosphere and an excellent choice of bourbon while you get your cut, if you so choose. Highly recommend.

text: Holly is the best in town for men's haircuts! Great price and great cuts! I know a couple other people who use her as well and they love the cut. Nice little shop too with complimentary beverages.

text: I moved to Alabama in May of 2017 and Holly has been my barber since day one. I have always had quality and a great atmosphere to get my hair cut. She is a great barber and i recommend her to everyone i speak to. She is super friendly and the quality of the experience you receive is amazing. Give it a try once and i guarantee you will be back.

resp.text: Thank you Mike for always being like family

name: Nesha James
text: Tonie is the best at smart styles she’s good with any texture of hair.

name: linmariec
text: After speaking with stylist Taylor about my hair and and asking her if she knew how to cut natural hair  (she said she did), we made an an appt. Despite showing her the cut I wanted and telling what I wanted she still cut off more than 75% of my hair and the cut looks absolutely nothing at all like the several pictures I showed her and explained to her. She was also late for the appointment and rushed through to finish me up. I am extremely unhappy as is my husband. Her lack of attention to my desired haircut has left me feeling angry, emotional and extremely dissatisfied. I would have rather her tell me she couldn’t cut it then to take it upon herself to give me a style she wanted for me. As, I am the paying customer. We spoke and she is aware of my dissatisfaction and has offered to re-cut it. However, there is nothing left to cut. My hair is shorter than my son’s. It is shorter than a TWA, a very masculine cut. The sad part is, it’s a week before Easter. 😥

resp.text:
We are very sorry to hear you were dissatisfied with your service, thank you for reaching out and letting us know. We always strive to provide a quality salon experience, and we have shared your review with our local Guest Service team.

If you would like to speak with a District Leader, please contact 1-800-737-3535 or departmentcs@regiscorp.com.

Thank you,
SmartStyle Guest Services Team

name: Amanda Jones
text: I normally never had any issues going here until the past 2 times. The last time I was there, the woman got the wax super hot and it looked like she ripped off skin with it. I just left and I'm super unhappy. She said it was difficult because i had fine baby hair (understandable). She marked it in with a brow pencil which made it look better; once I took it off, I saw the damage done. I'll be finding a new place and not coming back.

Needless to say the stylist completely messed my husband hair to the point today we are going somewhere else to have it fixed. When it was my turn I just got the ends clipped, which I thought she should not mess mine up. And she didn’t but did tell me sorry she couldn’t do anything with my hair. I will be contacting the corporate office

name: Ray Reynolds
text: Wow!  I usually don’t enjoy the haircut experience but this changes everything!  Not sure I’ll go anywhere else, ever again. Ask for the MVP. I’m so glad it was recommended to me by a friend.  Also, they have great products. I’m sold on the Mitchell paste. Thanks for a great experience.

name: Keric Frost
text: I had an absolute top-notch experience here. The staff is friendly, warm, and welcoming, as well as fun to talk to and they keep the facility extremely clean. I went here (my first visit to Sport Clips ever) on my lunch break while having a rough day, and my MVP package experience was as relaxing as it was enjoyable, and my haircut is one of the very best I've ever had in my life. I'll be going back again and again for sure!

name: Jonathan Esposito
text: This visit was great. Received a warm greeting upon entering the shop. I only had to wait for 2 customers prior to being called for my turn. Good things come to people who are patient and Christine is worth waiting for. Received a pleasant greeting with hand-shake. I received a haircut exactly the way I wanted it. I finished my experience with the complimentary MVP for Active Duty Service Members….Thank You.  And thank you Christine for the pleasant conversation.  I will definitely return.

name: J. Bryan D'Angelo
text: Great job and my and my son's haircuts - ask for Jennifer!

name: Daniel Galbraith
text: So I go in like I have been for 8 years or more and I log in and note my wait time. I sit down and look around for the 4 people signed in before me. Only 1 person is there? Kind of strange. So they call that person back and then it's explained to me that the other 3 people signed in online and they are kids all together. Then another customer comes in and signs in to wait. When the next hair stylist is ready she comes and gets the guy after me because 1) I'm waiting on a specific hair stylist and 2) the 3 other people signed in before me online aren't there yet. So next my hair stylist gets finished and the 3 people (kids) that signed in online show up LATE! She cuts their hair instead of moving them to the back of the line since they weren't even there when it was their time to get called.  Facing another 20 minute plus wait after already waiting 20 plus minutes. Bad business holding an online reservation when the people don't even show up on time. Sportclips should value people's time more than that. I will never set foot in there again.

name: Payton Rogers
text: I've been going here about once every couple of months for the past two and a half years and I've never had a bad experience (or haircut). If you're looking for a basic affordable cut, friendly and talented staff, and little to no wait time this is the spot for you!!

name: Finn
text:
This place gave me one of the worst haircuts of my whole entire life...
I asked for a bit of a trim and to leave my bangs long but they didn’t really listen at all and I got a dumb and dumber haircut, so just don’t go here. Trust me it’s not worth it at all.

text:
Excellent place. I’ve been going there for 2 years. My first visit,  I thought I was going in for a quick haircut but found out that Joaynn is very meticulous and takes pride in how her customers look when she’s finished. On average I’m usually in the chair and out the door in 25 minutes. She cuts hair by appointment only and it’s worth the effort to make one. Good haircut and a good price. Bring cash and leave her a good tip. She deserves it!

WOW!  I just read the review from C.L.  Obviously a misunderstanding somehow. I know Joaynn wouldn't treat anyone unfairly especially based on looks. She does keep her door locked for security and I don’t blame her after the crazy guy came in with the likely intentions of robbing her. Not really fair to call her customers Nazis either. Where does that thought come from anyway? Seriously???
I will continue to do business here!

name: Chris C
text: When making an appointment it says that it will charge me a 5 dollar fee if I’m late, therefore I made sure I was on time (Even a few minutes early). A few minutes later, or a few minutes before he finishes the current persons cut a man walks and shakes the barbers hand. I’m assuming that the man was friends with the barber because once the barber finished, he than proceeded to set the man up for haircut somehow bypassing my reservation. This really annoyed me because I have a busy schedule, and when making an appointment that would charge me if I’m late I would guess that I would be entitled to that time. But this is just the one of many problems with this unprofessional “business”. I will not be returning and I do not recommend going here to anyone.

text: I have been reading reviews for this Regis location. I am so sad to know there are so many unhappy guests having left . I hope the reopening and the current rebuilding of the team and guests' trust will be refreshing, as well as, solid. Thanks to those who take the time to make it known where growth is needed and hopefully, from this point forward , any could be issues will be eliminated during consultation. We are so happy to be servicing our community again,!

name: Terri
text: This place is a revolving door for stylists. Every time I find one I like they are gone a few months later. I've been though this over and over. I took a chance again a few months ago. So it was someone new again...they took about 10 minutes to cut my hair. My hair is coarse and thick so I need a lot of layering to get it to lay right. I asked for a cut I've had before, so I know it can be done. The reality is she wanted to hurry and did a cut that wasn't worth paying for. This isn't the first bad cut I've had there. A couple stylists before this I ended up with a circa 1995 Rachel haircut, which wasn't what I asked for. The thing is...if it's even halfway close to what I want then I'm not picky. The stylists here are just bad and it seems the good ones leave quickly. I'm done trying with this place. I'll have to find somewhere else.

text: Excellent hair cuts.  Freddy did a fantastic job of cutting hair.  However, they don't take appointments, and I've had trouble getting them on the phone.

resp.text:
Thank you, Josh. Sorry you had trouble reaching us and that we don't take appointments.

From another customer Matt M:

Freddy almost always answers my calls. However, he must have not had your number saved since you were a new customer. He receives so many spam calls and he may have thought you were a spam caller. They don't take appointments - probably because they have so many loyal customers that wait in line without an appointment and don't want to be unfair to them or cause them the inconvenience of having to schedule an appointment just to be able to get a hair cut.

They are in high demand. They have many loyal customers that probably never had made an appointment. Offering appointments now would probably cause more confusion than good.

Please consider changing your review to a 5 star. I'm glad you enjoyed their service.

- Matt M

name: Stephen Smith
text:
I checked in online for this Sportsclip branch (per all of their recommended advertising). The site told me 140min was the wait and said I should show up to the store at 4:15p.

I showed up and checked in and was told it was another 1hr45min. Turns out they prioritize all of the people who come into the store in person. If you checked in online your place is not saved and you are pushed back. Totally not fair and that made me feel kinda lied to and like I wasted my time. Im not saying I don’t I don’t understand that concept but that was not explained when I checked in…..

text: I’ve had great experiences with this salon. My young son is not always an easy cut. In the past, Andrea L. cut my sons hair. She is amazing and so sweet. Today, Priscilla H. cut my son’s hair and I couldn’t be happier. I will most definitely keep coming back with staff like this. It takes a special person to be patient and understanding with a difficult child (getting his hair cut is uncomfortable and scary for him). Thank you so much!

text: Never again.  After 71 years I finally got the worst haircut of my life.  Do yourself a favor and pay up for a salon cut or pay less at a lost-cost shop.  The choice is yours, but these people are awful.

name: Chris Stewart
text: If you go, ask for Constance. She's the best of all the stylists currently at this location. $21 is a lil steep for just a plain cut though. If it included a straight razor line up I could justify the price, otherwise there's better options for the money.

text: For someone who was cut his own hair with clippers for the past 10 years, they did a great job cutting my hair exactly how I wanted.  Raven was great.

name: Ian Burke
text:
4 out of 5 stars because no place is perfect but this place is pretty close to it.

The shop is well kept, clean, and the staff are always friendly. I have never once walked in there without being greeted with a thank you for coming and a smile.

Even if the wait is building, there is never a moment where you feel as though you are rushed.

I highly recommend this particular location. And if you are looking for a spot on fade? Ask for Rebecca.

text: Good location, great staff.

text: My boyfriend got his hair cut today. He asked for short sides with a fade and the top scissor cut. The girl pretty much did a high and tight (very short on the sides and long on the top.) He looks like the red head kid from Pheanius and Ferb. The top has no body and looks stuck to his head. Thank goodness his hair will grow out!

text: Never knew this place was here but holy cow! Prices are amazing and quality is top notch. Bethany did the BEST balayage, toner, cut, style and wax ever!!! I’ll never go spend 200+ dollars on my hair again when I can get it done by Bethany for half the price and ten times better results. Go see her ladies.

Outstandingly fast at haircuts (when I say fast I mean like less than 10 minutes) and her precision is impeccable! She definitely knows what she’s doing and I always leave happy. The women are so friendly too. You will not regret it.

name: Claire Baroni
text: Bethanie is a scissor whiz! My daughter and I love the friendly service and our styles. I love her knowledge about all the concerns I have for my hair. She is amazing! Great products in the salon and never a pushy sell, which is what I love about purchasing new hair care products.

text: Abigail and Bethanie are the absolute sweetest!! Such a fun time coming here getting my haircut. Abigail did a amazing job on my nieces hair and was so precise and Bethanie did amazing as well on my mother in law. Found my new salon that feels like home with these ladies. Skilled and fast! Definitely recommend.

name: Brittany Chilling
text: Very pleased with my highlights that bethanie did. It’s very hard to get the yellow orange tones out of my hair but she is a hair magician ! Came out a beautiful pale blonde just like I wanted. She nailed it!! Go see this girl for a color if you’re in the area, she comes highly recommended and has made a outstanding name for her self. Got me a new hair girl!

name: Jason Meloon
text: Very quick and professional. I usually don’t bother with reviews but I feel as though Bethany deserves one. The past few times I’ve got my hair faded it was by her and she’s always the one working long hard hours with a smile on her face and always gives the best cuts and edge ups. Check her out, you may need to call in advance to book with her.

name: Tina Townsend
text: I went here to get my hair cut and my daughters ends trimmed. We got there and the sign said they close at 6, it was before 5 when we arrived and as soon as we walked in we were turned around and were told they were closing soon. So instead we went to Great Clips(by Walmart in Hazel Green). There the staff was friendly and welcoming, I got a great hair cut and my daughter had a wonderful experience getting her hair trimmed. We then went back to the shopping center where Head Start is located to go to Publix to grab groceries for dinner. While in that area we drove past Head Start that still had their open sign on and they were still inside working. I was really disappointed because I see the great reviews but unfortunately we did not get that experience but it’s fine I will drive the ten minutes longer to go to Great Clips. Where I feel wanted and valued.

text: HEY EVERYONE! Thanks for all the great reviews! You can now find me at cuts and stuff in hazel green!! Come see me! -BETHANIE ANDERSON

Not going to anyone else but Bethanie and My Son Jonathan already seen her for a perm and he is following her to cuts and stuff . So everyone that see this go Follow Bethaine to cuts and stuff hair salan in Hazel green by Cassie Diner . Thank you Bethaine . See you December 1st .

Visited today to take my niece's hair washed. Melody did an amazing job! She was kind and patient.  Talking to my niece with love, care and respect. My niece is autistic,  nonverbal and likes getting her hair washed.
I also got a haircut, wash and eyebrow wax. Melody provided the services. I highly recommend going to see her.
I look forward to taking my sons for a haircut from her.

text: My uncle came in for a haircut and Cadence did not disappoint! He brags on this stylist and his hair. Very nice, glad the rude black lady is gone. Very nice and professional staff they have now. Plus the place smells like someone is always baking fresh cookies

name: Cheryl Edge
text: I gave stylist specific instructions that I wanted the exact same hair cut, just a trim and definitely no more than an inch cut off length, preferably less. She had me turned away from the mirror and I was horrified when I saw some long stands of hair on the floor. I told her you are cutting too much off. She said she was putting in layers. I said I already have long layers and just need it trimmed. Turns out she cut about 3 inches off and now my wavy hair has shrink up to a Christmas tree sitting on my head. I can barely get my hair in a bun for work and it will be months before I have enough weight in my hair to wear it down. My hair has not been this short in decades and I don’t even recognize myself. I will never come back here.

name: Johnny Bearden
text: This place has really come up. Nice hair dressers, redecorate, clean and smells good. Definitely good for business and I got a great cut. Will be back! 10/10

It was a disappointing experience, and there was truly no good reason for it.

I don't know how many times I am out and about and people stop me asking where I get my hair or my kids hair cut at. Kuts 280 should your go to shop!!!!

Irina and her spa are simply the best. My Son and I both have Irina cut and style our hair. Her warm and welcoming manner, the relaxing atmosphere of her Spa, and her commitment to super service for customers, make a visit to Solo Man Spa memorable. It is truly a relaxing experience for me.
Please give Soli Man Spa a try; you will not be sorry.

name: Bryon Spence
text:
TL:DR "Best haircut of my life for only $16, you won't be dissapointed at all."

Got my haircut today by Sir Jones and he made sure that he knew exactly what I wanted and how I normally style. This may seem like an obvious thing to do, but as a man that gets a haircut every two weeks, its not normal for them to get that in depth. The professionalism was abundant, however you also know that the barbers are real people and make everything comfortable.
On to the actual haircut.
I have never once had a barber pay such attention to detail and ensure that not a single hair was out of place. The time was put in to ensure that everything would turn out exactly how he envisioned my hair would. From clippers to scissors, not one strand was able to hide from this man. He then styled my hair exactly as I would have, and applied the proper product with a good hold, to ensure I would be looking fresh all day long.
When it was all over I stand up to pay, and he tells me, "That'll be $16."
I was left speechless, I have paid a lot more for a lot less of a haircut.

resp.text: Thank you. Come see us agin

text: Up visiting from Florida and needed a haircut bad. I was afraid that New Beginning was going to be just  another chain clips, but it was close and had good reviews.... I got what my wife called the best haircut she has ever seen me get. They took their time, hand blended and lined me up, without rushing me out just to clear a chair. This is exactly what you would hope for, that old school Barber Shop experience with super competitive pricing... My wife appreciated it so much she went to the car and tipped him an extra $15.... Worth every penny!!

text: All you need to know is below. If you can’t plan your haircut around his schedule, he charges you more. Sometimes double. This discourages new customers (new revenue!), unless that is what his goal is. Good haircut though.

resp.text:
Walk-ins are welcome up to 30-days from your last haircut...10 minutes at $12.00, greater than 30-days since the last haircut; the rate will increase. The greater than 30-days haircut solution is to book an appointment in-person, by phone @(793-4992) or via the T & Company Barber Shop website:
https://www.t-and-co-barber.com/
This is absolutely your choice!!!  Thank you.  Have a great day!!

name: Camille Whitfield
text:
***UPDATED Review (5 Stars)***
I went back after work and I was given the best service.
She corrected and blended the chopped layers. It is about 4 inches shorter than I like, But it looks and even feels so much better!
My suggestion is, when you go in, ask them if they are comfortable with doing the cut and or style you are requesting. I would have been way more satisfied the first time if the lady who cut my hair originally would have told me she isn't comfortable doing layers. I didn't have to pay for the Re-Do but I did tip. (Which I shouldn't have had to pay for it since it was as bad as it was, so glad they didn't charge me!)
***Original Review (3 Stars)***
I only ever come here.. today I walked in, got someone brand new. And my hair looks absolutely awful. I am going to go back in tonight and hope someone is there that can fix this. It is supposed to be layered and it looks like it was just cut straight across. And it took almost a full hour for this monstrosity. Very upset and hope it will be corrected.

Great "old school" barbershop, to include a shaving cream/straight razor neck shave at the end!

name: C Cannon
text: Great hometown barber shop feel complete with wood paneling wall and lounging patrons engaged in chit chat. My barber was the right mix of customer friendly and candid demeanor you expect from this type of establishment. In spite of my protest for him to continue eating, my barber got up from his morning breakfast and coolly stated "that's what microwaves are for." Then he got to the business of his craft. He even did a straight razor shave on the back of the neck complete with a warm towel. The shop is quaintly nestled in the revitalized old town area and makes you glad you skipped a franchise place. Sometimes they can accept cards, but bring cash to be safe. Anyways, it adds to the whole experience.

text: Jasmine recently moved from Vestavia Barber Shop to here.  I've only let four or five people cut my hair in my life, as I've been butchered elsewhere before.  Jasmine is very talented and takes the time to understand your hair and wishes.  Simple to complex, fast to methodical, she can deliver. For any review comparing Supercuts or the like, you get what you pay for in life.  I prefer to spend $10 more to not look like a schlub with someone who is well trained, experienced, and cares about the final outcome.  I hear the shop may be offering appointments now in addition to walk-ins, so I would inquire about that if your schedule dictates.

Only accepting cash at the time of writing so be sure to ask if they accept card when you call.

Now I specifically told her i inch for hair length and to simply edge my beard.  What I got was a half inch over all sheering.  Believe me I have had better results from a Navy barber on ship at sea then I got here.  I was also offended that it looks like she was using a American flag as her patron  cover.  I only give then 2 stars because they seemed somewhat friendly.  No, I won't be back.

resp.text:
We're very sorry you were displeased with your service. At Plaza Barber Shop we try to treat each customer with respect and give them the haircut that they request.
I am also sorry that you did not like my apron that has an American flag on it.
I've had very many positive comments on it.
Plaza Barber Shop sincerely hopes you find a barber that does make you happy.
Thank you for stopping in.

name: Christian Pereyda
text: Since I became a regular patron of this establishment in 2019, the business's current owner, Mr. Dan Sartain, has always provided me top-tier service for a fantastic value. Situated inside an early Twentieth Century brick edifice with an ornately decorated window matching its red, white, and blue barber’s pole, Dan Sartain’s Barber Shop harkens back to Woodlawn’s founding and  has been a fixture of the community since 1904, when the space was first occupied as a single-chair, 12’ x 22’ establishment. Mr. Sartain seized the reins of this establishment in 2019, and he has since continued the tradition of cultivating conversation, community, friendship, and mutual understanding while wielding a pair of scissors that that this barber shop has symbolized for over a century.

text: As a woman walking into a barber shop, I felt a little out of place. But I asked about a simple trim and Kirk the barber said that it was no problem at all! He finished with his current client and i was next. My hair is straight and quite long, about 3 ft I suppose, and just needed a good trim. Less than five minutes and four inches later, I was getting out of the chair. And he wouldn't even let me pay him! So I left a tip and said thank you! The fellas in the shop were really nice and didn't seem at all surprised to see a woman in the shop. Kirk the barber is awesome! Also, a little foot note, Kirk provides drinks/water and a restroom to the USPS workers who come through during the day as well. Kindness is everywhere and Kirk gives it away freely! Thank you

text: I thoroughly looked into a barber for my boyfriend after he moved here and needed a new place to get his hair cut. We had tried a few other salons nearby and all the woman that cut his hair missed parts of the fade or made his hard part too thick. When I saw all the 5 star reviews for this place I was hesitant, but I went on the website to do some research and found the story stating that this was a one man shop owned by a young man named Brett and that he was very experienced in the barbershop industry. So I sent my boyfriend there and when he returned I was very impressed with his cut. He did a fantastic job and didn’t miss any attention to detail...clearly knows what he is doing AND best thing was that it was way more affordable than going anywhere else nearby! My boyfriend liked Brett and thought he did an amazing job as well, he also said Brett was very personable! Needless to say, all my boyfriends’ haircuts will be with Brett from here on out!

name: Michael Martin
text:
Brett, and subsequently now Gallantry Barbershop, is the choice barber in Chelsea, AL. Brett is highly professional, cares about the haircut as much as the person below it, and charges a fair rate ($17/$10 for veterans (it may be $12, either way its a discount)), and listens to your wants and needs regarding your hairstyle. My son's (all 3 of them) have never looked better stepping down from the chair. The shop being new is very clean, well styled, and offers an assortment of beverages. Between the excellent customer service and the fair pricing, the clear choice is Gallantry.

I have tried all the local barbershops/chain hair cut stores in town and here are my experiences:

Super Cuts/Great Clips: Avoid. Period. Employee turnover is horrible and professionalism meets no one's standards. Hair cuts might as well be done with a butcher knife. The old adage, you get what you pay for, applies here.

Buzz & Cuts: This is the factory of barbershops. You sit in the chair, get manhandled by someone who does this 1,000 times a year, get a half way decent hair cut and then bumped out of the chair by an often rude stylist. The only perk is that if you can put up with the lackluster customer service and average hair cut, you can save money with a frequency card. Honestly, its not worth it.

Chelsea Barber Shop: Ms. Faye is a staple of the town and has been there for a long time. The shop is large, clean, and generally a friendly atmosphere. If you are looking for a barber who talks and gossips with you in the chair, this is the place for you. Be warned though that the conversations get....intense....sometimes. The problem I have found here is consistency. My haircuts range from above average to sub par. My kids hair is basically a trip around the edges and call it a day; no matter how much I insist otherwise. The consistency problems continue with the hours. The hours posted on the door are dependent on the mood of the stylists, their personal schedule, and whether or not it was busy enough that day to keep the doors open for the full time. I have gone more than once where the shop should be open, but they closed up for the day (once at 11 AM and another at 3 PM within the last month.) If you are personally going for a hair cut where you have the time and patience to make sure its right and can catch them when they are there, this would be my #2 choice.

name: lisa white
text:
Had my hair cut here @ the Hartselle location. I showed the young lady a picture of the cut I wanted & even told her....
1. I have naturally curly hair so please don't cut it as short as hair that is straight, because curly hair "shrinks" up after drying.
2. I said I'm aware that you may not be able to make my hair look exactly like the lady's hair in the picture, but I would like for it to be as close to the picture as possible. Wasn't even close.
3. When the young lady was finished & I seen  my hair, needless to say I WAS NOT THE LEAST BIT HAPPY, NOT EVEN A BIT OF A MORSEL HAPPY. Paid & left with tears in my eyes.
4. THE RIGHT SIDE OF MY HEAD LOOKED AS THOUGH I HAD NO HAIR, OR BARELY ANY HAIR, BECAUSE THE YOUNG LADY CUT IT SO VERY, VERY SHORT AFTER ME ASKING..... PLEASE DON'T CUT MY HAIR REAL SHORT, BECAUSE IT'S CURLY AND CURLY HAIR "SHRINKS" OR MAYBE A BETTER  WORD TO USE IS "TIGHTENS" UP.
5. I had to ask for it to be cut while wet & not dry, then had to ask for it to be blow dried & styled after the messed up cut... all of which was included in the price I was paying.
I will not go back to SUPER CUTS. I wasted my time, money & tip I gave the young lady, even though I shouldn't have done either.

name: kagura shimoto
text: I’ve been to this place multiple times over many years and not once have I left with a haircut I was happy with. They don’t ever ask you about how you want your hair cut, and when you do tell them how you want it cut, they never cut it according to your parameters, one visit, one of the barbers attempted to thin my eyebrows with a pair of clippers and shaved 2/3 of my eyebrow completely off. They smoke cigarettes while they’re cutting your hair, and the place just doesn’t seem sanitary at all. The only thing that is redeeming about this place is that Frank gives you a hot shave with a straight razor. And that’s if your lucky enough to even have Frank cut your hair, he’s the only barber there that is even qualified in my opinion, all the other ones have messed up my hair and facial hair.

resp.text:
It's difficult for me to walk and chew gum at the same time.  As I imagine it would be the same smoking and cutting hair simultaneously.  And, smoke would get in my eyes. Please consult me personally for any dissatisfaction with staff and or services.
Frank

text: I've been getting my hair cut here since I was 3. I now live about an hour 1/2 away . Tried some of these new, "trendy ", places that are supposed to be more modernized. I now make time, (somehow ), even if it means I have to go a week or two longer than what I would like it's much better than having these people butcher, gap, and cut one side of my head 1/2 an inch longer than the other. They just don't train barbers like they used to, specifically when it comes to clippers. And when you get your hair cut very short 3/8" difference will stand out like a sore thumb. Great hometown people, professional service, great prices  !!!

name: Katie Jay
text: I love everything about this salon. I’ve been going to Kayla for a few years now and I can’t imagine going anywhere else (I literally drive back from Atlanta just to go to her). She was the first person to cut my hair after 10+ years of grow out which was a HUGE deal for me. Ever since then I have trusted her creativity and she has done some amazing Vivids on my hair and I can’t wait to keep working my way through the rainbow with her. 10/10 would recommend her for any fun vivid colors.

name: brittanyislovely *
text: I love coming here! Kayla always does the best job with my hair! We’ve tried a few different coloring styles & they have all been great! She even helped me when I decided to make a big cut & take off several inches of my then very long hair! She is also very easy to talk to & always in a a great mood. I know she is also up for any hair transformation if you’re interested but I just haven’t been that bold yet! I highly recommend this place for anyone in the area looking for a new hair stylist.

name: Emily Sexton
text: It’s always such a pleasure going in for a cut/color at Muse! The atmosphere is very inviting and there is usually some interesting conversation about travel/books/local events going on around the color table. Jana sits down with me before we get started and we talk through what we did at the last appointment, how that worked for me and what we’re doing this visit. Jana is fantastic! I always leave happy and looking forward to my next visit!

name: Emily Bear
text: Danielle did a fantastic job on my hair! I absolutely love it, which is why I am leaving a google review along with the review I left on their website. I cannot wait to continue the process of making my hair look awesome again with Danielle. The prices are reasonable. The other stylists who work at Muse all get along and seem to genuinely enjoy working together. Thank you guys for being awesome! I will recommend Muse Salon to everyone.

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to leave multiple reviews, Danielle is a wonderful artist.  I am so glad you are pleased and look forward to seeing you in the future!

name: Sara Gilmore
text: I come here probably once a month and it’s fantastic! Everyone is so nice but Kayla is the absolute best and always takes care of me! I recommend her to all my girlfriends and family members! She never disappoints. Every time I think she’s done her best she shows out the next visit! GO SEE KAYLA!

resp.text: Thanks for the positive words!  We are so glad to hear that Kayla is taking great care of you

name: Debra Lorberbaum
text:
I started going to Kayla about 6 months ago.  I have been to a lot of stylists over the years.   Love Love Kayla.  The coloring she did for my hair each time is perfect.  She knows exactly what to do.  Love the way she cuts my hair too.
If you are looking for a professional , fun place to get haircut or coloring please go see Kayla at Muse Salon

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 stars Debra!  I am so happy you are please with Kayla, she is great.

name: Debra Nettleton
text: I love Muse!!  Danielle always does a fantastic job with my hair.  Great color, cut, and style!  She gets me!  She takes the time to figure out what I want.  The atmosphere at Muse is so relaxing also.  I highly recommend Muse Salon.

name: Paige GGG
text: The best salon in BHM! Kayla is phenomenal, she always takes your 'service' and makes it an experience. Awesome product recommendations and fair service pricing each visit. I have been a client for more than two years now and refuse to let anyone else touch my hair again!

resp.text: Thank you for your review and loyalty.  I am glad to hear that Kayla is taking care of all your hair needs, she is an awesome hairdresser!

name: Elizabeth Kilgore
text: After going to Muse, I can't imagine using any other salon. You can't beat this atmosphere or level of customer service. Kayla did an absolutely fantastic job in creating the exact look that I was going for! I would highly recommend Kayla for any service that you may need.

name: Emily Stewart
text: I previously saw Kayla for years. She does such a wonderful job, is fully invested in her clients, and does whatever she can to make you happy. Her work is phenomenal! I am sad that I moved away from Birmingham and can no longer see her. She is the best!!

name: Beth Thomas
text: Love Muse Salon and Jana! I have always had a difficult time finding a stylist who learned my hair. It is fine and extremely thin. Jana listened and gave me options, which I liked a lot. Please never leave me Jana!

name: Logan Stewart
text: Dani is the absolute best! She does an amazing job coloring and cutting my hair. Dani helps me brainstorm new ideas that I always love! She goes above and beyond to make sure I am happy with the my hair and the service!

name: Lyndsey Green
text: Love this Salon! The whole staff is friendly and set a great vibe! My stylist, Dani, always works with me to achieve the ever-changing crazy ideas I bring in!! She nails it every time.

name: Jillian House
text: I love going to Kayla at Muse Salon! She always does an amazing job on my hair and does exactly what I ask for! I never liked getting balayage until she did it! She’s also just a great person. Highly recommend!

resp.text: I am so glad you are getting exactly what you ask for and are happy at Muse, we cant wait to see you again!

name: Beau Latham
text: I use Kayla for my men’s haircut and she has always done an excellent job! She is so fun to talk with while she’s cutting my hair it almost makes me want a 2-3 hour hair treatment so our conversations don’t have to end!

name: Sara Copenhaver
text: Muse has been a fantastic salon experience! The salon has such a positive and upbeat energy that comes from the way the stylist  work as a collaborative team and this translates into fantastic results on each head of hair that walks out of their door! Kayla has been keeping my blonde bright and beautiful while staying shiny and healthy for a couple of years! And as ladies who were naturally blonde until after babies know...... this can be tricky! She’s worked some magic for sure! Thank  you Kayla!!!!! 💜💜💜

name: Lauren Howard
text: I’ve been using this salon for years. Kayla always takes great care of my hair and gives me a chance to relax at the same time! She does an amazing job with color and cuts, and she gives great recommendations on products for my hair needs.

text:
Muse Salon has been my salon since they opened.  Pleasant and friendly atmosphere.  Always on time.
Everyone works together and so genuine.  Always up to date with the latest trends.  I feel very confident at Muse and highly recommend if you looking a salon home. 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

resp.text: Thank you for the review! We greatly appreciate it! We hope to see you soon!

text: My stylist is Danielle. She’s the best! Very professional, very with the trends, she takes her time and truly cares about her clients. The salon is very welcoming.

text: Muse is such a lovely experience to make an appointment at. Kayla was wonderful at giving recommendations and attentive to what I was looking for. I highly recommend Muse in the Birmingham area.

text: Muse is my go to salon! Kayla is amazing and worth the drive down 280. Most professional salon I've ever used!

text: Very friendly, top notch service. Have taken great measures to be safe during COVID times.

name: Karen Day
text: They keep up with me, and I love the reminder texts a week before, day before and 2 hrs before. They know me well, ha! My color recipe is on file, along with notes on my cut, and they’re all really good. They have classes and travel to training, constantly staying up on the latest trends. They’re serious about personal growth, and therefore the salon’s quality.

resp.text: Thank you so much Karen! We love having you here!

name: Sophie M
text: After a BAD experience with a high end salon in town, I called Muse and booked the first opening available with Crimson. She literally worked MAGIC salvaging my hair, which had been cut way shorter than I wanted and generally made me look like a dowdy ole maid. She knew how to cut it with my hair texture in mind, and did it all without taking off more overall length. For real could have cried when she finished because it was so so much better than how I came in. I left feeling like a million bucks and can’t wait for my next cut with her!

resp.text: Thank you Sophie. I am so glad we were able to accommodate your needs! We cant wait to see you again!

name: Jessica Saylor
text: I absolutely love Muse Salon! I've been going there for over a year and I've never been disappoint! The stylist do a great job, they are very professional, and well trained.   Every time I go, I leave very happy and loving  my cut and color. Several people have commented on how great my hair looks, saying they love the color or my haircut. I would definitely recommend Muse to anyone.

resp.text: Thanks Jessica!! We love that you love your hair!!

name: Adrianna Dasilva
text: This was my first time going to this salon. I was extremely happy with the whole experience! The entire staff was very friendly and Emily did an amazing job with my hair! I got a cut and color and it turned out better than I even imagined. Absolutely love it and highly recommend going!!

name: TANA S BRITT
text:
It's so refreshing to have everyone, from the Receptionist, Stylists and even the Clients, to be friendly and/or Professional!
I've resorted to cutting my own hair for the last few years because I couldn't find anyone to cut it for me except for the 'cookie cutter version' of the latest style.
That is, until I met Jana! As a Master Stylist, she takes my fine hair and texture, face shape and even my cow licks all into account as she listens to my dream of having long healthy hair into my late 50's! Gladly teaching me little tricks of the trade along the way.
So thankful for Muse Salon in Birmingham, AL and especially thankful for Jana and her knowledge and art of styling my hair to look my best!

resp.text: Thanks Tana!! We cant wait to see you again!!

text: Muse is a welcome respite from the rest of your hectic day! I have been a loyal customer of Muse since the day they opened and I would never go anywhere else. text: Hunter took care of me on my first haircut since the pandemic started and couldn’t have done a better job. I’ll be back for sure.

name: Malcolm Williams
text:
I'm visiting from out of town for military training and needed a cut late in the evening after work in a town I'm not familiar with--especially on where to the find a black barbershop, because you can't just type in "Black Barbershop" on Google yet and expect it to know what you really mean, yet.  Still, after some research ( meaning looking at the pictures on reviews to see if was a black barbershop)  I went to Heritage first because it was closer,  online stated that it closes at 7pm, but when I arrived at 6:24-- the Heritage crew inside looked at me from behind a locked door and gestured "sorry".

Anyway.

I didn't realize it then, but that was a blessing in disguise because I quickly found Hunter's on Google, and it was only three minutes away and open until 9pm.  When I walked in I was greeted warmly by an older gentleman dressed in a suit and hard leather shoes-- Hunter in the flesh-- and the joint. was. packed. I initially suspected that everyone in there were all like me and didn't make it to Heritage on time, but I quickly realized that they were there not because they were like me, but  because they already knew what I didn't, and that this was their go-to spot, for several reasons.

Place wasn't hard to find with GPS, a small unassuming barbershop that we're all familiar with the look and feel of.  Aside from a TV with the game on or music, those who frequent black barbershops don't even expect all the bells and whistles-- we're here for two things- a good cut and for some; a spot to come get caught up on the daily local news and gossip--and maybe for the younger guys...a little mentorship.

Setup was professional with a nice array of clippers and lighting and very COVID safe.  Hunter told me off the bat that it would be an hour wait, and that if I left my number he'd call me when the chair was ready--which I really appreciated.  An hour later I was back and he was just wrapping up.  Hunter can cut hair really well and FAST.  He took care of two customers in under 15/20 minutes and they all looked CLEAN. His efficiency is really what amazed me first, and the clean cut he gave me was perfect.  Thanks for the convo, laughs and excellent service Hunter on my first visit to the great state of Alabama.

name: Robert D
text:
First, I apologize this is a late review/post. Let me start with some background. I retired from the military a little over a year ago out of Michigan and haven't shaved since. Being in the military for 30 years, I've never had a beard. So I'm new and learning. And finding a barber who can give a proper trim has been a struggle. I haven't had many trims, but I'd never had a trim I didn't have to fix myself, until I came here.
So after around a year after retirement I find myself down here. Short of a couple family member, I don't know anyone here or anything about the area. The search starts again for a new barber. So I tried one previous shop before this one. The haircut was ok, but the beard trim was an absolute butcher job. I had to wait a good time letting the patches fill back in before I could get a trim again. Then I found this place and gave it a shot. I couldn't have been happier. Ray cut my hair and gave me a beard trim. He spend around an hour on my head. When I first arrived, there were a few customers,  but not many. Ray was the only barber present at the time. While I was in the chair, another barber showed up, and more customers started showing up. It was getting busy. I thought for sure Ray would start rushing my cut, but he did not. He just kept at it, and paying close attention to detail. Ray didn't not just cut my hair and trim my beard, but he invested time and genuine effort. He cared and had pride in his work. Craftsmanship, hard to find these days. I have found my new barber shop, and I highly recommend it to others.

One stylist and she was finishing up a cut on one customer and next cut a one year old babies first cut with hardly any hair! She never recognized me there and after finishing the baby at 5:50 she began sweeping and then looked at me and asked what I needed! I said a shampoo and conditioner! She said we close at 6! I said well why didn’t you say you wasn’t going to have time to service me, she said I thought you were just getting a trim! Trim or shampoo it’s a service! She did not say anything else to me and kept sweeping the floor! I put back the products I was buying and left the store peacefully but very upset! Yes I am a lady of color,  does cost cutter service people of color still? Just asking for myself?

Visited June 19th between 11 and 12. Girl I got had long mouse brown/blonde hair. I asked for a graduated bob, stacked in the back at the base of my neck and below my chin in the front a good 2 inch difference. What i got was a pageboy straight across front and back just below my ears. She was in such a hurry I did not get a good look at it until I got home. After I cried. I realized it will take awhile to grow out in order to repair this.  I have gotten excellent service here previously. But not on this day. This is a very bad style on me and the stylist DID NOT LISTEN TO HER CLIENT. I need a frame around my very round face. This is depressing.
Laurie Bristow

The stylist hacked my hair off where it looks blocky and uneven, and she took off way, way more than I asked for. I have long, curly hair and only needed a trim. It looks absolutely horrible now.

She also complained about the other customers in there to me. It was my first time there.

I know you get what you pay for, so I guess I shouldn't be surprised, but I would seriously recommend against going to this particular place. Unprofessional behavior and unskilled hair cutting.

text: If you want a haircut you can go anywhere but if you want true hair value go to Morgann. She cares about the health of your hair. If you want someone that will listen to you and make you walk out feeling glamorous, she is your stylist. Morgann has done a great job on my hair for  10 years. She is the only person allowed to touch my natural curls. She always does a great job. I love that I set up an appointment and I don’t have to worry about anything.  I do not want cheap hair so I am willing to pay a professional to do my hair the right way the first time. Just because this salon is in WalMart that doesn’t mean these are “wanna be stylists”.  These women/men spend their time and money learning a trade to help support their families. I love my SmartStyle stylist Morgann. I trust her to do anything and I mean anything that she wants to do to my hair. MORGANN YOU ARE THE BEST EVER!!!!

So my mom went in and got her hair done after being told $16.98 on the phone when she went to pay it was $32.00.so we spoke to the same lady that told Us 16.98 on the phone and she agreed it was $16.98 needless to say the lady that done my moms hair still charged her over the pice we was told Over the phone. I feel Like she was taking advantage of. We will never go back here again and I sure hope this doesn't happen to anyone else especially the eldlery on a fixed income. I would give 0 starts but I have no option.

resp.text:
We're sorry to hear this, Kayla - thank you for letting us know. We strive to always provide a quality salon experience, and we have shared your review with our local Guest Service team.

If you or your mom are interested in discussing this with a District Leader, please contact 1-800-737-3535 or departmentcs@regiscorp.com.

Thank you,
SmartStyle Guest Services Team

Because I am not from the area and I really needed my hair done I continued to wait. 2 hours later she contacted me asking if I was at the shop I informed I was. She said you got the times mixed up and apologized. I'm human I understand that. She said she was coming. So i continued to wait! This was around 12ish. I got frustrated with waiting and left she called saying I'm on my way to the shop now. By this time I left heading back to Bham I had had it to Prattville! I turned around thinking I have a full day ahead i really needed my hair done. So I went back to the shop she still wasn't there. I waited almost another hour after driving 20mins from Prattville. As I was walking out the shop I noticed a lady in her car eating ice cream, nevertheless it was Diedria as if I haven't waited 4 hours for her to do my hair and telling her I wasn't from Montgomery and I had a 9:30 appointment. She asked as I was leaving was I about to go!?!?!? Because her ice cream was more important than keeping a schedule appointment or being professional! Will never go back! Beyond unprofessional

name: William Andrews
text:
New to the area ... Have found my barber/stylist.

I am new to Huntsville and asked around for a good barber.  I was referred to Claudia here at Cliff's.  I was a little hesitant going anywhere other than a regular "barber shop."  Claudia took very good care of me.  She listened to what I wanted and made recommendations as well.  I have been going here for over 3 months now.  She does a great job.  I usually call or text the day before to schedule an appointment, which allows me to get right in without waiting.

It's $20 for a regular cut, which I thought was a little high, but she does such a good job, it is worth it.  If you need a good haircut, stop by and see them at Cliff's.  I highly recommend them.

name: Cavana Faithwalker
text:
This place is now called  Cliff's Family Hair Care.  They should get their web presence up to speed.  Started in 1957 and now run by Cliff's son Dewain Becket.
I can only speak of my experience with Claudia. It was a great experience.  I hadn't cut my 3 foot long length of hair in about 25 years.
I don't know Claudia and she was genuine, warm, welcoming, and had me at ease quickly. We had met one other time and she talked about doing, " a little bit here and a little bit there."
I was even more at ease when we talked about what to do and she started to work.  She is exceedingly confident and talented. "I've been doing this long enough," she said.  As an artist myself I picked up on her fastidious hands and meticulous gaze that showed her talent, experience and intuition.  Before I got up she had me sit back, "hold on, those two hairs are bothering me," snip!
Yeah this will be the only place I go when I'm in Huntsville.
The shop itself for me has a nice intimate feel and it is great to walk into Claudia's space as opposed to into a row of chairs.

name: Brian Farley
text: Claudia cut my hair the other day.  She did a great job and my wife loved it as well.  My other barber closed up shop, I have found my new barber shop!  Only slightly more than a Wal-mart type place, but you get what you pay for and she did great job. Highly recommended!

name: Johnny Tims
text: Stephen is now the only person I will let cut my hair. I have always gone to chain places and gotten basic haircuts. I finally decided I wanted a nicer cut, and found Stephen Gregory's through Google. He asked what I wanted, I told him I've never gotten anything more than a basic cut, and was hoping he could just do something without my head looking to big. He got to work, and it took about 45 minutes to an hour. I felt like he actually cared about how my hair looked, unlike my usual experience of seeing how fast they can get you out of the chair. I walked out pleased, knowing I would not go anywhere else. Entirely worth the money. Then, I had to run some errands after. I have never caught so many women staring, and doing double takes in my life. A great haircut really can make a difference. 10 out of 10, Stephen will make you look like a hot b**ch.

name: Spencer Tidwell
text: Everyone working there was super nice and professional. They allowed me to do a walk in and Mrs. Deanna did a great job!

name: Lance Huffstutler
text:
The Stephen Gregory salon is one of the best salons I’ve visited. The salon is always clean, well organized and sanitized. The equipment always looks new and kept up well.

The app makes it really easy to schedule appointments and manage your experience. It gives you the ability to see each stylists availability and choose from there. I booked Grace after one of the other stylists stayed packed and have been really happy with her cutting my hair.

Grace, who is always super friendly and accommodating, does great work on fading the sides and making sure the edges look great before you leave. I like that she accommodated my schedule if I’m able to come earlier

text: I have spent the last 15 years trying to find someone who can fade my hair correctly. Grace at Stephen Gregory is the very best. The service is well worth the 30 min drive. Each of the stylists is knowledgeable, friendly, and engaging. The studio is clean, well maintained, and has products that are made for men. The membership program is the way to go. Gents, this is where you should get your haircut. Ladies, you should send your man here to get your haircut.

name: Sean Dunn
text: I've tried many barber shops in the Birmingham area and can without hesitation say this is the best.

resp.text: Wow! Thanks for the super kind words. We are so glad to know you were pleased with the experience!

name: Hannah Malone
text: My husband loves Deanna! She always does a fabulous job. Per personality & professionalism is top quality. He won’t let anyone else touch his head! The salon is always clean & Stephen frequently checks in on all the clients.

name: Daniel Thorp
text: I had my last few appointments with Jennifer Snell at this lovely establishment. Regarding her, she is a very talented stylist and always willing to go the extra mile. As far as the business as a whole, very professional yet laid back. They are compliant with all COVID issues, and seem to be well managed. They have a convenient process easily tracked with their app, and will even offer you a drink as you walk in. 10/10 guys/gals, good job!

resp.text: Wow! Thank you so much for the kind words! We truly appreciate your business and support!

name: Ringo Hulsey
text: Im new to the area just moved into town for work and had been skeptical about finding a new hair stylist I had been going to the same person in ATL for years. After about two months of no hair cut I finally broke down and scheduled a appointment for the ultimate (hair cut, beard shaping and eye wax) with the man himself " Stephen Gregory "  and let me tell you I was not disappointed. The business was very professional and clean, more of the high end quality I was looking for. I highly recommend and will be back every 3 weeks, Remember to take cash for a tip or have Venmo ready to tip your stylist as they do not accept tips off your debit or credit card.

resp.text: We are so happy to know you were pleased with the experience! Thank you for giving us a shot and we can’t wait to see you again! Welcome to Birmingham!

name: Brian Stansell
text: Deanna is always on point with my fades! 100% recommend this business and Deanna is the best!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! We truly appreciate your business!

name: JARED PETERS
text: This is one of the best barber shops in Birmingham. The staff is always very professional, well dressed and super friendly. The open concept definitely has the Birmingham look, in addition to proper social distancing between each station. Would definitely recommend.

resp.text: Thank you Jared! We appreciate your business!

name: Heather Campbell
text:
We have been coming to get my son’s hair cut here since his first hair cut 3 years ago. I wouldn’t trust anyone but Jennifer to do it. She’s patient with him even when he’s wiggly.

The overall experience here is better than any other salon or barber shop we’ve been to.
Not to mention it’s gorgeous inside.

Thanks Jennifer for the wonderful job, and Stephen for the wonderful establishment!

name: Lauren Beiter
text: I love this salon! Grace has been my barber for a couple months now, and never fails to amaze me with her work! I love the energy in the salon, everyone is always very sweet and welcoming! I definitely recommend coming here if you want a trustworthy shop to give you the best fade.

name: Matt Daemond
text: I've been working with Deanna and it's been a very pleasant experience getting my hair colored. Prices may be slightly higher but so is the quality of staff. The attitudes and atmosphere is great which goes to show that higher prices can be worth it!

text: Grace has been cutting my hair for over a year. I drive over a hour but it’s well worth it. Best haircut, always on time, very professional, and economical. Highly recommend Grace if you want a great cut.

I’ve been going here for the past 1.5 yrs ever since moving back to bham. Grace Bivin has been cutting my hair since the beginning and is absolutely the best! As a guy going from various long to short hairstyles, her technical skill, suggestions, and overall personality are what keeps me coming back. Along with Grace, the other staff are very friendly and welcoming. I use the app to book my appointments, which is intuitive and easy to use.

Highly recommend going to Steven Gregory for your next haircut.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!!

We would certainly appreciate the opportunity to make it up to your boyfriend. Please call the shop and ask for Stephen, the owner. He will be happy to discuss a resolution with you.

text: It’s official! The Stephen Gregory Salon is seriously the best thing to happen to men’s hair in Birmingham. If this man ever leaves the city, we’ll all be (or at least look) the worse for it. If you aren’t getting your hair cut here, you’re missing out. I’ve been nearly everywhere, and this is the best.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words! We are thrilled to know we have met your expectations!

name: Cole Roberson
text: Do yourself a favor and go here. I just can’t imagine not being happy with this place. I saw Stephen and I wanted some guidance and a beard trim. He absolutely took care of me and explained why he was doing what he was doing. I won’t ever be able to make my beard look as good as he did, but with his advice I’m hoping I can keep it respectable in between visits. I love two hours away, and will definitely be making the trip just to see him a few times a year. I read a ton of reviews for everywhere around Birmingham. What stuck out to me was on the couple of reviews where someone wasn’t happy he came on and asked the person how he can make it right. Not everyone is going to be happy all the time, but one of the cornerstones of a great business is properly dealing with an unhappy customer. He is absolutely focused on him and his staff making people happy.

resp.text: Wow! Thank you so very much for the kind words! We are so glad you were pleased with your experience in the shop. Looking forward to the next one!

name: D. Chase Rosenbaum-Callahan
text: Jenn Snell, y’all! She was absolutely fabulous. I had the ultimate haircut and a facial and I can’t get enough of how good I feel and I look. My hair, scalp, eyebrows, skin are all on point!!! 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! We’re so glad you were happy with your service.

text:
I looked for a salon on line, and S. Gregory's caught my attention by virtue of the advertisement's design, and subsequent provision of information as well as expeditious on-line booking.
Upon arrival, I was greeted courteously. The environment reflects style, a reflection I soon found in my stylist's skills notable knowledge of his craft, products and the execution of a tailored hair style, one with which I am very pleased. Recent words of choice that are a decent fit: posh and panache. Bravo!
I shall return.
TAT, an educator at UAB.

Take a load off and enjoy your haircut here with service unmatched by anyone else around.

Unfortunately, beard grooming services are tough right now with CDC guidelines of wearing a mask while in close proximity of others. We hope you’ll give us another shot at impressing you soon. Please reach out to our management by calling the shop if you’d like to discuss your experience any further.

Definitely will make this my place of choice for all future appointments.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind words! We truly appreciate your business!

name: nathaniel spence
text: Always a pleasure. Great work.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind review! We are so happy to know you were pleased with the experience!

name: Steven Broadway
text: Stylist undercut my hair on the side as opposed to disconnecting the side from the top along the part. Looked terrible and had to be fixed. Additionally, $35 is an incredibly high price for a haircut that doesn't come with a stylist that is confident and knowledgeable (she kept stopping to ask me if it looked okay as she made adjustments: I brought a picture and gave specific instructions "low fade starting with a 1.5, disconnected at the part and scissor trim on the top, tapered on the neck). If I were to pay $35 once every other week, including tip, I would expect a consultation, a comfortable stylist, one that understands the common or even less common terms and styles, and an atmosphere that is conducive to relaxing (Store was quite, echo-ed, and awkwardly staged). I know that it is rather common in Alabama to have a haircut done every 6 weeks or some astronomical time frame, but coming from a larger city where my experience was better at the $23 ($27 after tip) price point and the cut a better quality with some input and know-how, I'm extremely disappointed.

resp.text: Hi Steven, I am so very sorry about your bad experience at my shop. As the owner, I want every single guest to feel they received the best cut ever & leave their most confident. I would truly appreciate the opportunity to make this right for you. If you haven’t already had the cut fixed up, I would like to cut it for you myself free of charge. If you have already been to visit another salon or barbershop, please allow me to personally do your next haircut in a couple weeks free of charge. If nothing else, I would at least like to speak to you over the phone or in person so I can gather more information & learn how to correct this with the barber you saw in my shop. Please stop by the shop or call us at 205-703-8076 and ask for Stephen.

name: chad outdoors
text: Jennifer is great 👍 love this place

name: Nikhil Verma
text: Great haircut everytime!

name: Tim Casper
text: Came in from another place with one of the worst haircuts of my life. Within 3 cuts Stephen has crafted and maintained one of the best haircuts of my life. Recommended forever.

resp.text: Thank you Tim! So glad you’re happy with the results!! We appreciate your business.

name: Doug Knutson
text: Stephen was great! Attention to detail and very professional while fairly priced at the same time! Very pleased

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! We appreciate your business!

name: James Black
text:
Edit:   After a bad experience, Stephen contacted me.   He went above and beyond all expectations to make everything right.  I walked away with a great haircut and wonderful experience.

I got a shampoo, haircut, and beard trim.   The haircut is honestly the worst I've ever had.   It was styled while it was wet and looked fine.   Once it dried out, however, I soon discovered that it wasn't blended, there were whole sections that weren't even cut at all.  It looked like I had 3 pony tails sticking out on random parts of my head.     The entire hair cut only took a few minutes and I just don't feel like my stylist paid much attention to doing a good job.

Additionally, the beard trim was terrible.   I asked the stylist to trim my mustache so it wasn't in my mouth.   After combing it out later that day, there were whole sections that were completely uncut.   Combed straight downward, my lips looked like a barcode where there were random whiskers sticking down.

I understand that stylists have bad days, but when you charge 5 times as much as a standard haircut you expect a higher quality.

This haircut was much worse than the $8-$12 haircuts I've received in the bast.    After tip, this trip to Stephen Gregory cost over $90.     It was a complete ripoff.

resp.text: Hi James. I’m so very sorry to hear of your bad experience in the shop. As the owner, it’s my goal to ensure everyone leaves 100% satisfied. I would truly appreciate the opportunity to correct this cut & beard trim for you 100% free of charge. It you wouldn’t mind, I would like to discuss this either in person or on the phone. Please call us at 205-703-8076 to discuss when you could come in to have this corrected by me personally. Just ask for Stephen when you call.

text: Men’s hair salon. Cut, Color, Beard grooming .

resp.text: Thank you for visiting our shop! We’re glad to hear you were happy with the haircut, too! Should you be interested in future visits, please consider our monthly membership in order to receive discounts on cuts and other services! More info can be found on our app or by calling the shop.

name: Matthew Golia
text:
Jennifer Snell was my hair ninja earlier this week, and she did not disappoint.

Parking: park in the garage behind hotel indigo, exit at street level, and turn left. Tokens provided by salon to allow for free parking

Salon: Clean, modern, beautiful facility, completely wireless. Stephen Gregory is one of only 5 Redken Ambassador Salons in the US!

People: friendly, inviting, smiling, courteous, knowledgeable, amazing!

Experience: Jen knows hair, knows her products, knows her Salon. She was talkative, but also attentive and focused when necessary. I am always up for an education, as the more I learn about my hair line, type, and thickness, the better I understand what can and cannot be done. Jen was willing to take a moment to school me throughout the entire process.  She employed a few techniques that had not graced my scalp, ever.

Overall: Stephen Gregory is on point. The value is amazing, the people are knowledgeable and so personable, and the experience is top notch. I am already getting exciting for my next visit. Lucky for me my hair grows super fast.

Mahalo Nui,
mpgink
