name: SM FW0322
text:
My son & I needed haircuts - we didn't get the task completed prior to vacationing in Gulf Shores. I located Gentleman's Quarters Barbershop on Google. I reviewed these postings & decided to try it out...
We walked into the clean shop & timed the arrival perfectly at 10am. We were greeted as though we are regulars to the shop...
My son went 1st. The attention provided to my son & the patience shown to my 7yr old was simply the best.
Our haircuts are perfect.
The price was extremely affordable.
Thank you - highly recommended from us!

name: Daniel Mullaly
text: Tracy was excellent, I highly recommend. I walked in without an appointment and got a nice cut, hot towel shave, and neck massage. Nice treat. The staff at the hotel were so friendly too, and the hotel is beautiful. I waited out by the pool watching the ocean while she finished with another customer, doesn’t get better than that!

name: Justin Littrell
text: They cut my beard well.  I only pay for haircuts on vacation, and it looks better than when I do it.  The polished my skull too!

name: James enderosn
text: They did a great job considering how incredibly squirmish my 2 year old son is.  They made up for it by doing the cut quickly while we distract him, and the haircut still turned out great!  Now he's ready for the hot summer days ahead.

name: Erich Hebner
text: Let’s go through my entire experience: I called set an appointment and everything was On time and perfect. I walk in was greeted by Melanie and she made sure everything was clean and sanitized before I sat down! She is wonderful to talk to and definitely a hard worker. I came in with a blurry photo of what my hair was before this entire Covid thing and she nailed it perfectly. And no one ever does because I have the thinnest hair and it’s very difficult to work. Also she lined my beard up touched up my eye brows and the whole 9 yards. And styled my hair for the day!! If your a guy that is traveling and you have your hairstyle you like and that one person you’ve been using that gets it right every time Melanie is Legit and this is definitely worth the money. The prices here are unbeatable definitely undercharging for sure so make sure you guys tip! These people deserve it!!!! I wish I had a before and after to show you so you could see the magic that just happened! Everyone have a great day and this place easily gets 10 stars thanks again Melanie!!!

name: Ben Probus
text: We are in on vacation from Kentucky. Melanie Hyatt was my barber. She’s amazing! Professional look and beard trim! She did the best work I’ve ever had done with my hair! I highly recommend her and the Gentleman’s Quarters Barber Shop! -Ben Probus

name: Reid Foote
text: Ms. Sylvia is amazing!! Just came in at 430 on a Friday and got a very nice haircut in about 10 minutes for only $15!! Really nice spot too. Very clean. 5/5

name: Bonnie Reynen
text: My partner and I snowbird in orange beach, he has his hair cut and recommended Sylvia, she did amazing job, i went back and she put low lights in my hair so I can grow out natural. She is amazing!! Will recommend her to anyone I know.

name: Stormy Ousley
text: We walked in 15 till close and Sylvia was so sweet and fit us in and even stayed late to make sure my husband was happy.

name: Reade Hocutt
text: I only wish I lived here so I could go here every two weeks. I stopped in while on vacation and it was great. Cut looked good and service was better. Immediately felt like a regular with the conversation amongst stylists and customers.

name: Steve Brooks
text: What a great place. Hospitable, great price and Sylvia was fantastic! I will be back.

name: Terry Walker
text: Very nice haircut! Firsy time in there and I will definitely be back.?

name: brad williams
text: Call themselves a barber shop but can not cut a flat top or shave a face.

resp.text: Brad I'm curious when exactly you came into our barbershop?  No one has any record of you coming to the barber shop for any service. Please provide further information as I do an awesome face shave with hot steam towels between each step. So I'm a little confused as to your review stating no face shave as well. I also saw where you have left a 1 star review for another barbershop stating the same thing you stated for our barber shop so I'm just curious if you were every truly a customer of ours in our shop since we have absolutely no record of you in our system. Actually you have left multiple 1 star reviews not just for barber shops but a variety of businesses every where you go stating the exact thing over and over. Seems like you may have a problem all over the country from all the locations of your reviews. I hope that works out better for you in the future. It must make for a miserable vacation for you and your wife to be that unhappy every where you go.

name: Bjørnar L
text: Great place. I was passing through on vacation and needed a barber to fresh up my pompadour. Mrs Hyatt understood exactly how I wanted it done and did a great job. Would definitely go there again.

name: Lea Dudley
text: Sylvia is the BEST!!! Found her when she used to be at salon at Walmart and have been a regular ever sense. She always goes above and beyond!!! She can do wonders with my hair!!! Always come out looking better than when I went in. You can't go wrong with Sylvia. I'm probably going to regret doing this cause I won't be able to get in when I call cause I've told you about her. LOL

name: Ray Minor
text: Stopped in for straight blade razor shave.  Tracy handles the razor very nicely.  Extra hot towel over the eyes was nice touch.  Was great experience.

name: Alan Carnrike
text: I've taken my boys and I here several times and have not been disappointed. I met Melanie on my last visit. She was both professional and courteous. I plan to return to here again and again.

name: Jason pate
text: Tracy is the best. Easy in and out location. Always a cold drink available and the haircut is second to none. Try the hot towel shave next time. Its awesome.

name: Ryan Robinson
text: Love this barbershop! Tracy has been cutting my curly hair for years and she ALWAYS does an Excellent job and strives to go above and beyond expectations! If you’re a guy and you’re looking for a barbershop that’s later back, friendly and well managed...then this is the place for you! Check it out and be sure to ask for Tracy!!

name: Chad Wetzel
text: Miss Tracy is excellent! Great experience and a very nice place. Cannot say enough good things about her and my experience there. Definitely will be back again and again!

name: Pat Howe
text: I had been barber shopping for a little over a year after I moved into the area  2 years ago,thankfully I stumbled across Tracy Mixon one afternoon and have not gone to anyone else since.  She knows her stuff and the cut shows it. Attention to detail, premium service, and as many barbershop service perks as you care to choose from, all at an incredible rate.  Don’t waste your time anywhere else in the area, all other places are burn and turn joints, when you are in her chair she takes her time to get it exactly right for you. 5 stars easily.

resp.text: Thank you Pat! I truly appreciate you. Your loyalty means everything.

name: Jash Yotes
text:
Tracy is the best.

I'm really glad she finally started doing her own thing after bouncing around at some of the other barber shops in the area. Great place for a men's haircut.

name: Captain Mike
text: Professional, friendly and always pleased with their services. Local or tourist, snowbird or resident, get your ears lowered in this cool atmosphere with friendly folks!

name: Eric Niemisto
text: Been getting my beard done with the owner for several years now. This is her new shop. Shop has awesome character and great staff. Hot towel and a strait razor shave is top notch!  Ask for Tracy and make an appointment you won't be disappointed I promise.

resp.text: Thank you Eric! Its always a pleasure to have you and your family at the shop!

name: sean peenstra
text: Sometimes you stumble upon a place that amazes you.....haircut w hot towel and quick massage...WOW....very nice people..go there

My boyfiend loved the Kobalt tool benches. The inside is rustic chic. Very nice. Tracy gave him one of the best haircuts. Highly recommend this cool shop.

Thank you!

resp.text: From what I'm gathering from your review it sounds like you are a female snowbird here for the snowbird season. If that is accurate, a womans haircut is $25, a blowdry and style is $10, resulting in the $35 charge. We are a barber shop but we do accommadate couples during snowbird season. Please message with additional information so this can be resolved.

name: JULIAN RUEDA

name: rebecca smith
text: Such a great family friendly environment. The management staff is top notch. Run here. My babies have grown up here getting their hair done. My 9 year old loves getting her nails painted as well. Ask for Olivia when you go. Best hair place in Mobile.

name: Yuliya Ugay Brown
text: Stuff is very nice and  friendly. But I asked not to cut hair from the ears and see what happened... He had ears covered with hair.

name: Shianna simpson
text: Absolutely loved them!! Went for the first time today & i felt so welcomed & was treated GREAT!! Highly recommend them!!

name: Tamara Perry
text: Wonderful salon for my 7 year old. It's fun and they have fun products. She loves it every time we go!

name: Katie A Barnett
text:
I just stumbled upon Knots Salon simply because I needed my haircut ASAP. I called on a Saturday and was able to get an appointment that same day!
The salon's setup is so chic! I immediately fell in love with the ambience. I have thick natural curly hair so I am always nervous having my haircut by someone new. When I scheduled my appointment I requested someone who has experience with cutting curly hair...and of course that's exact stylist I got! I was just a walk-in expecting to get my hair cut and go back to my original stylist after her leave, but instead Knots Salon just got another regular client!!!
I also tell everyone about this place because I was shocked that I didn't know about it!
I love Knots Salon for life
...Katie Barnett

resp.text: Thank you so much for the great compliment.  We certainly appreciate your business and will always strive to give you a 5 star experience.

name: Ashley Davis
text: We absolutely love Knots Salon! It's so inviting for kids, which is hard to find. We took our 2 year old, who is a very busy body, to Knots Salon for his first haircut. Angela is who we chose and she did absolutely AMAZING! She listened and did exactly what we asked. She was great and oh so patient with him! There's no where else our kiddos will go for any hair needs.

name: Amanda Negri
text: Amazing! Ms. Olivia was so great with our son and he loved it! Easy experience!

name: Raven Hamil
text: I love taking my child to get his hair cut at Knots! The staff are so sweet and very good at what they do. Leighana is so patient and takes the time to make sure she makes my son's hair look great! Would recommend Knots Salon to everyone I know. Especially for kids haircuts.

name: Amber A
text: Absolutely wonderful customer service! They pierced my daughter's ears, both at the same time and she got her first haircut and her very first Manicure💅

name: Mary Boice
text: Angela is always out to give me the exact hair style I want!  She didn't cut too much hair off the way other hair dresser do.  She is very sweet!  She has lots of experience!  You definitely want to ask for Angela!  She's the best!!

name: asten hamil
text: Knots is a really good salon especially for kids. Leighana does a really good job cutting my nephew's hair.

name: James Hudson
text: Inexperienced people run this place . Don’t set a appointment if your hair is “to thick “ because they will turn you down after waiting a week for your appointment.. horrible service . Anyone getting hair colored would definitely not recommend this place they clearly are inexperienced

resp.text: We are so sorry you did not have a good experience at our salon! It is our goal to provide excellent service for all of our customers. Unfortunately, the appointment scheduled online did not allow enough time for us to give you the color you were looking for. We hate that we disappointed you and hope that we can make it up to you. Please call us at 251-635-1313.

name: Reyna Coleman
text: We absolutely adore Ms. Olivia. She’s patient, kind, & caring.

name: Kristy Dyess
text: We love Olivia and everyone there. Michael has been going there since he was 1 and he is now 12!

name: Brittany Kimbrough
text: This morning, I made the mistake of taking my children to another salon. My daughter’s hair was long, halfway down her back, and I wanted 3 inches trimmed off. The girl butchered it and before I knew it, my daughter had an uneven bob above her shoulders and the girl just kept cutting and cutting on top of repeatedly blaming my daughter for not sitting still and blaming another customer for talking to my daughter and making her talk while she was cutting her hair. I refused to let her touch my son’s hair, we hopped in the car, and drove to Knots Salon. By the time I got there, I was in tears. ANGELA SAVED THE DAY. She fixed my daughter’s hair and gave my son a great cut, too. I will never take my kids anywhere else! Take your kids to Knots and ask for Angela. She works miracles and is so great with the kids.

name: Jennifer Hall
text: Great with first hair cuts and kids love to come!  They can’t wait to come back and sit in the cars. As a parent, it’s so convenient to be able to schedule appointments online.

name: Katie Ladnier
text: Very pleased. She only cut what I asked and was very understanding and easy to talk to. Enjoyed the shop itself aswell.

name: Megan Rushing
text: Best haircut and color I've had it years. Latisha Speese did amazing work with my long thick hair. Will return and can't wait to bring my daughter.

name: Ethan Bryant
text: Love getting my haircut at Knots. I've gotten my haircut by several stylist and all are pretty great at men's hair. The always use a warm towel when shampooing my hair, and give a great neck shave. Highly recommend.

resp.text: We love that you enjoy our services.  Thank you so very much for the great review.

name: Jessica Tillman
text: Marley did a great job on my 2 year old boy. First time haircut, and she was patient and kind, and most of all fast!! I got to keep his curls! We will be back for all his cuts. Love this place

resp.text: Thank you very much for the awesome review.  We look forward to seeing you again.  Marley is great and she loves children and what she does! Can't wait to see you!

name: Andrea Timberlake
text: We kids love Knots Salon! It’s a very kid friendly atmosphere, yet great for adults to relax and get chic too!

name: Grandmaster
text: Only professionals here with positive attitude s. The owner is great and has a reflection on her employees. By appt only. Also equipped with unique powerwheels stools for kids haircuts.

name: Vanessa Madere
text: Friendly staff and great haircuts in a cute salon

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind review.  It really means a lot!

name: Holly Reynolds
text: They always do a great job with my toddler.  He used to hate haircuts but is always so well behaved here!

name: Abigail Stjohn
text: Very open and friendly staff. Perfect for families! Left the salon with smiles all around! Also LOVE the selection of bath bombs!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us this fabulous review. We really appreciate it!! We work really  hard to serve our guests and love to hear that we did a fantastic job.

name: Andrew Hardin
text: My delightful sister works here!! Great place!!

name: Will Hudson
text: Great haircut experience. The salon was excellent and on time.

name: Audrey Wright
text: Perfect for a birthday spa day.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review.  We love doing spa days for children and adults.  We will even open after hours if needed to fit your needs.  We love what we do!!

name: Mariea Hayes
text: When I first walked in, I was greeted. I love to see people who have an interest in new customers like this particular Smart Style. I got a trim and the price was decent. (Which is a plus) I also got a $2 discount by it being my first time.. Ms. Markisha was the lady to do my hair and she's VERY nice. If you go to the one in centerpoint be sure to ask for her.

name: Angela Gomez
text: Walked in today at 4:59 to get a perm and style and the lady that was in there said it was past the time the could see customers . Hmmm I looked online it says they close at 8 . The clock hanging on the wall was pushed 10 minutes forward to make it look later than what it was. I even looked at the time on my phone and it was exactly 5pm. To me it seemed like she just didn't want to do it because I saw her sitting in the back relaxing . Don't even waist your time going here.

name: Lilith Presson
text: Usually wait a long time, but prices are decent.

name: Erica Baker
text: Asked for service and didn't get it lady saying she had to leave at 3 if they didn't want to assist me that's all they had to say

name: Lisa Mccombs
text: Best color I've had done yet! And I was so relaxed that i actually fell asleep while the lady was styling my hair. Great experience all around!

name: Melany McMurtrey
text: This place is amazing. They have a great new amazingly qualified staff. They are amazing at what they can do. The prices are amazing as well. You should go check them out.

name: Theo Vaughn
text: All I can say is amazing! Great deals awesome haircuts and a great big smile from the staff, what more could you want. I would recommend these girls to anyone.

name: Lexi May
text: Kayla Garrison was my stylist. I came in and didn’t really know what I wanted. She helped me choose a haircut, color, and style that flattered my facial features and that also suited my lifestyle. She was incredibly nice and she really knew a lot about hair. Before I left she taught me how to do my hair at home and even showed me the same products she used on my hair. I am 100% pleased with my visit and will be back every 6 weeks. I am very impressed with how friendly everyone there was and how relaxing the salon is. I had a free consultation with my appointment. I would recommend anyone who is needing a makeover to go see Kayla at Mastercuts. She is also on Facebook and will answer questions on there after your service! It’s like having your own personal stylist available 24/7! And I must mention the salon was very clean and organized and had a very good atmosphere. Everyone was so happy there and seemed to love working there. Thank you Kayla for such a nice visit!

name: Stephanie Kelsey
text: Highly recommend Amber. I've had Amber do my hair numerous times. Highlights, haircuts, blowdries,always love love the outcome. She's the sweetest thing and has a shining personality that matches her work.

name: denjus007
text: Before the new ppl, I could get a haircut when they are open during said business hours. Now, you better get a cut on their schedule because I can't count what number this makes that they've turned me away. One hour left for a ten min cut and they can't do it. That's the last turn away for me. You don't want my business, someone else will.

text: My daughter went to get her hair cut. It was all the way down her back, to her waist. She told the girl she wanted the ends to lay between her shoulder blades. She walked out with hair not even touching her shoulders, about chin length.  The woman was distracted by a kid that was in there with someone, and evidently wasn't paying attention.  Bad thing is I believe she was even the manager.  I won't ever go there again, and neither will my daughter.

text: Used to be a good place to get hair cut or styled in the past few months it's gotten to where no employees would show up on time or show up period and they would send you away very high rate of turn over apparently but however when they were fully staffed it was a good place to go but we've been turned away so many times we just found another place to go called that hair place it's in the mall not to far from master cuts

name: Jennifer Owen
text: I paid $60.00 to get my hair colored black. I sat for 3 hours and my hair is two different colors. Mistakes happen. So I call up on my only day off to see what time I could go in that day to get it fixed. This woman tells me, "Oh, well the stylist isn't here today, you'll have to call back when they are here". Really?!?! I did not shell out a lot of money to have it messed up and then be told only they can fix it. Will never go there again.

name: Beth Eason
text: I know they have some bad reviews, but for a shop that accepts walk in's, they are very nice and considerate. If they have a wait time, they will even call you when it is your turn. Eva cut my hair and she was very sweet and patient. She had me laughing almost the entire time.

text: From brow waxing, shampoo and styles, formal hair, perms, color services, men/women/children cuts, fades,.... they have stylists who are comfortable doing everything in the salon. Super nice stylists, clean, family friendly, and always go out of their way to help.

name: Barbara Bostick
text: I went to cut my bangs there once, the girl that cut them did an amazing job for my first time going to a mall and getting my hair cut. So, I expected for it to be the exact same experience this time around when I want to chop my hair off. Worst experience ever. She seemed like she hates her job or something or maybe it was just me she hated. Her name is Tiffany. I could tell she was in a terrible mood when she started washing my hair, she washed my hair so hard that I was fixing to ask her what her problem was??? I decided to not say anything, then she started cutting my hair, I asked for her to cut my hair up to my shoulders and have choppy ends. She made me look like Johnny Depp from Charlie and the Chocolate Factory except with one end is shorter than the next. White she was chopping my hair off, she kept pulling my hair, very very hard, she didn't even seem to care!  The whole tome, not a single word, not a single smile. Just asked if it looked ok with a horrible attitude, I didn't have the nerve to tell her that she butchered my hair. I have never felt more uncomfortable getting my hair cut. I ran from there hoping to not cry in front of her. So now I'm here at home crying from what seemed an hour from hell. All this happened 30 minutes ago. I will never ever recommend this lady to anybody.

name: Chris Stewart
text:
So let me 1st say that after years of frustration trying to find a barber that can consistently cut my hair the same way time after time I've come to the conclusion that to really appreciate a good barber you need to take your lumps experiencing some terrible ones first.

The good news is that the excellent barbers here have been employed at some terrible shops in the past, i.e. Plaza Barber in Cahaba Heights & The Male Room in Hoover....and now have learned exactly what not to do to if you want to keep the customers coming back. Seeing those butcher shops for what they are, they smartly decided to open their own shop and haven't looked back since. The two ladies here are both excellent, take their time, and consistently churn out quality cuts again & again, regardless of whatever style or on-trend cut you're looking for. On top of that, the prices are very reasonable, $17 for an adult cut if I'm not mistaken. Give em a try, you won't be disappointed.

Please, please, please take heed of the negative reviews for this place and stay away. Worst barber I've ever been to by far. It's unfair to the term barber to even refer to this whole crew as such. Median age of the group working here is 60+ so I should've known better than to ask them to do an undercut for my son, but it was so bad I had to go down the street to a Supercuts of all places to get them to fix what was left of my sons hair. Definitely time for these guys/gals to hang it up for good.

Don't believe me? Go see my Yelp review with pictures of my son's hair and try and argue otherwise.

resp.text: Thanks David . We are glad you took the time to leave a great review. We really appreciate it..

name: Scott Manges
text: I’ve been going there for 2 years. I’ve been patiently waiting to return for a haircut, and when I arrived today I saw a sign on the door stating that you have to call for an appointment. This is law so I’m not upset. I call and ask if there are any openings and they say no. Not for atleast another hour and a half to two hours (3:30pm). I’m not upset because I understand how busy they are. As another man walked up he asked me about what was going on and I explained it to him. The entire time I was doing this I was standing outside the door. The door opens and the owner lets the random guy in. I asked what was going on and  the guy says “I guess he’s letting me get my haircut. After I did the right thing and called in and waited outside, a random guy who walks up behind after me as I’m standing there is accepted after you told me that there were no availabilities.

resp.text: Scott. I had just walked in from the  back door from lunch.  I had not been told any of this information. I had an opening because I got back early. You had called another Barber for your appointment. And she gave you that information. It had nothing to do with me . It was a miss understanding. So sorry you feel that way. Have great day.

text: Yesterday was my first time visiting. It was a good experience. They were very attentive to the way I wanted my haircut. I left very pleased with the results. I highly recommend them.

resp.text: Thanks. We really appreciate your review. Have a great day.

name: S. Davis
text: Glenn’s Barber Shop is WONDERFUL. The stylists were so friendly and accommodating to my elderly father when I brought him in for a haircut. He is physically disabled, has some memory issues, and is grieving the recent loss of our Mom. Dad’s mobility is very limited, but we were able to get him through the back door with a walker to avoid the curb and traffic out front. His barberJim was so kind—listening patiently to Dad’s stories and encouraging his chatter. It truly lifted his spirits. The haircut was top notch, and Jim even trimmed Dad’s eyebrows—all seemingly small gestures that had a significant impact.  The folks here are courteous, compassionate, and inexpensive. We are now clients for life!

resp.text: Thanks S. Davis. I'm glad I got back to you with the message. We really try to make customer's feel good and comfortable. Jim did do a good job and enjoyed talking with your dad. We appreciate your taking the time to leave a review. Thanks again and best wishes to you and your dad.

name: Anna Jackson
text: Stylist from this salon posted about me on social media, all while reading and not responding to my text. I couldn’t make my appointment due to an unexpected procedure on my shoulder which made me unable to move my left arm or sit in any one position for too long. Said in her post she was “an extremely understanding person” but couldn’t even be bothered to respond.

name: Carmen Bustin
text: WARNING!! Chelsea Loeb removed "Reviews" from her Facebook page, "Vanity Hair Studio at Sola Salons", @VanityHairStudio88, where her mother decided to intervene and childishly berate me. I didn't want to have to do this, but since the BBB in Northern Alabama closed my case as "Unresolved", because she didn't reply, as usual, so I have to take to social media to tell the Facts so this can't happen to anyone else. I sent this to BBB & posted a Google Review & will continue to post to make others aware! Chelsea Loeb has scarily moved on to jeopardize the business, "Sola Salon Studios (a.k.a.Vanity Hair Studio at Sola Salons), but EVERYONE should be warned!!!! 2&1/2months now My hair had teal/green streaks that was NEVER requested & now the streaks are fading to a rusty color. She said she would fix her mistake & ceased communication when the messages clearly showed "Read". Original hair plan, ALL OVER blue/black "PERMANENT" hair color. Then Chelsea spoke of some "Pre-lightening" streaks. Wasn't too sure what that was, but entrusted she knew what she was doing since I told her my "Original" hair plan. 1st Salon appt, 4/23/18, Chelsea only touched up grey roots on top half of head & "Pre-lightened" streaks & dyed them teal/green!! I asked for ALL OVER permanent hair color, not just partial roots, & did NOT ask for TEAL/GREEN! Chelsea then processed a 3rd color on my hair within 3 hours, to cover up her first mistake. After 3+ hours there, it was supposedly "fixed". Knew it wasn't, but after 3 hours, I was done. Reached out to her the next morning, 4/24/18, to have it fixed before our beach trip the following day, 4/25/18. Chelsea then supposedly applied a "permanent" all over color, what she called a blue "Fantasy Color", & was told to rarely wash my hair so the color wouldn't fade. I know enough about hair color that a "permanent process" should not "wash out" in showers. Unfortunately my nightmare came true. Ruined friend's linens we visited whilst on beach trip. Couldn't swim in Resort pool or at beach because blue was pouring out in showers & is was "washing out" 38 days later. I paid for "Permanent" color, not "wash out". Returned from beach trip & respectfully asked her for a refund on 4/30/18, since what I paid ($135) for was not remotely done. Chelsea replied, "Unfortunately we don't issue refunds since the time & product spent..." So I asked for it to be fixed "again" since I did not ask for the teal/green that's showing again since her 3rd color is "washing out". The same day, 4/30/18, Chelsea agreed she would once she returned from her beach trip. 5/7/18, I asked her what brand of "Fantasy Color" did she use so I can figure out how to get this color out for good for I was tired of ruining my own towels & linens. She replied the same day with "Pulp Riot", but didn't offer any other advice, considering she messed up my hair. Of course I followed thru and researched the product, only to find out that it "Washes out in 42 washes...". As stated before, I paid $135 for a "Permanent" hair color process. That same day 5/7/18, I asked if she could fit me in the following week to correct her mistake. No reply. One week later, 5/14/18, I messaged again to see if she can get me in next week. Still no reply. Most insulting is that the messages let you know once they've been read & Chelsea has "read" them, and still no reply. I don't want her touching my hair in fear she will ruin it more. I just want my refund so I can go elsewhere that's more professional & knowledgeable to fix HER mistake. Insult to injury were her Facebook posts during the 2 weeks I was requesting her to fix her mistake. She was clearly telling the Facebook public that she had openings. Why not reply to my requests to fix her mistakes?! Filed a BBB complaint May 14, 2018, & she had until May 31,  to respond. No reply. Then had 10 days to respond. No communication until 2nd BBB letter. My pictures and her complete disregard of her own negligence is proof enough on her lack in professionalism and customer service & is UNacceptable! Still "UNresolved"!

name: Elizabeth H.
text: Nikki at Restoration Salon is fantastic. I had my first appointment with her yesterday and I am honestly blown away with her attention to detail, passion and knowledge. My hair looks and feels the best it has ever felt. I hate that I didn't start using her sooner but I am so excited for her to help me achieve my hair goals. Nikki, thank you for helping me feel beautiful and like myself again 💕

I went in super nervous since I have unruly, long, thick, curly, frizzy hair and have had horrible experiences so haven't let anyone touch my hair in years. She explained everything! What she was doing and why she was doing it. She really takes the time to listen and explains what works best for your hair. I am positive I found my new salon home!

name: Natasha Williams
text: DO NOT go to Summer Hornsby for anything! Not only is she horrible at doing color, but she’s also a THIEF! She left spots in my hair, black patches! My hair is breaking off and is completely damaged! She charged me 212, charged me for a hair cut and binding treatment both of which I didn’t receive. After I left the salon I realized she didn’t cut my hair so I asked her if I could come back another evening, she booked the appt but the next day i was doing my hair and noticed a lot of black spots in my blonde which made me livid. I sent her a polite text to which she replied that she would refund me the color and cut. It’s been over 10 days and I have not received a refund or any responses to my messages. Basically, this is worse than a bad stylist, Summer stole from me by not providing services that I paid her for.

text: New York Dixie does the best job with hair. Lucia is so warm and sweet. It feels like you are visiting your best friend who just happens to be styling your hair. I am so thrilled with the way I look!

name: Sharon Sargent
text:
Rachel Patterson (studio 6-Salon Nova) is fantastic! She really knows her stuff and only Rachel will be cutting my hair from now on.

I just moved here a few months ago and when I got here I went to a highly recommended super expensive fancy salon (not going to name names...starts with a T...) and was handed over to a stylist that sliced and diced my hair into a inconsistent and uneven mess of layers. It was bad. I let it grow for about two months and decided it was time to try another hair cut.
I found reviews of Rachel's work online and they weren't lying. She was awesome! She amazingly fixed my hair and made it look better than it did before my horrible cut. She couldn't fix all the short layers this time but was able to blend them so they were not noticeable while we wait for them to grow more. Couldn't be happier! Thanks Rachel!

text: I’ve never been here until 2 days ago, staff was friendly and business was clean. My biggest issue came with the actual haircut though. My barber didn’t seem to have much care in her work. She didn’t make sure my sideburns were even, there were no questions about how to cut the bangs so they were poorly cut, and when cutting the crown it was cut too short. I looked like a porcupine and all she had to say was, “Maybe you can use product.” Maybe I could use product but maybe the hair could’ve been cut with care. Not worth the $20 it cost especially when I can get a professional hour long session for $25 elsewhere.

name: Bear Dude
text:
I liked the "old-school" aesthetics that the place had, but when I walked in, I wasnt greeted at all, by anyone. This could be because both barbors were focused on cutting hair, since they were both at work, but even a simple "hello" would be more welcome.

I just assumed that I was supposed to sit on the long bench, alongside the other two people in the barbor who weren't getting their hair cut, and so I did, and I waited until I was called up to get my haircut. The barbor asked me how I wanted my haircut, so I told him how I wanted it and he cut it as I described, and then I gave him the $12 and left, without either of us saying a single thing to each other after I described my haircut.

name: Angela Blackmon
text: DO NOT BOOK AN APPOINTMENT ONLINE OR THE APP. I BOOKED AN APPOINTMENT DAYS AGO. GOT A CONFIRMATION SAYING IT WAS GOOD. THE DAY BEFORE MY APPOINTMENT SAID IT WAS REMINDING ME OF MY APPOINTMENT SAID PLEASE CLICK HERE TO CANCEL. COME TO MY APPOINTMENT AND THE MANAGER SAID I GOT AN EMAIL SAYING IT WAS UNSUCCESSFUL. ONLY AN HOUR BEFORE MY APPOINTMENT. SHE TOLD ME THAT IF I HAD BOOKED OVER THE PHONE OR IN THE STORE IT WOULD HAVE BEEN ON THE SCHEDULE. BOOKING ONLINE OR APP YOU CAN GET BUMPED OFF THE SCHEDULE IF SOMEONE CALLS IN OR COMES IN TO SCHEDULE. WHAT A LOAD OF LAZY BS! IF SOMEONE BOOKS AN APPOINTMENT AND DOESN'T CALL TO CANCEL OR GET A CALL LETTING THEM KNOW ITS NOT BOOKED THEY WILL EXPECT GO BE ABLE TO COME TO THE FREAKING APPOINTMENT THEY MADE! NO ONE SHOULD GET BUMPED BECAUSE THEY WERE UNABLE TO CALL OR GO IN PERSONALLY. PEOPLE DO WORK AND ARE NOT ABLE TO PHYSICALLY GO IN PERSON OR CALL ON THE PHONE. IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO HONOR AN ONLINE BOOKING THEN DO NOT HAVE IT ON YOUR FREAKING WEBSITE! THEN HAVE THE AUDACITY TO SAY YOU CAN COME IN TO BOOK AN APPOINTMENT TOMORROW. NOPE! I JUST BOOKED WITH A 5 STAR REVIEW PLACE SAME DAY TODAY! I USED TO LOVE THIS PLACE BUT THEY HAVE LOST MY BUSINESS AND I AM TELLING EVERYONE I KNOW ABOUT THIS! CALL ME A KAREN OR WHATEVER BUT THAT IS NOT PROFESSIONAL!

name: Khyla Bodie
text: Thick hair beware- I took my mom to this salon as a special treat for her birthday. It had been years since she had been treated to a girls day and so today was a special girls day where we could get our hair cut together. We live in Florida and wanted to spend some time in Dothan visiting our favorite shops. We booked an appointment and scheduled our day around town. My mom was so excited when she sat down and explained what she wanted. Instantly the stylist scowled and said "I'm gonna let you know now... your hair is not going to do that"  My mom has had this particular cut before and explained that it was okay and that she wanted this cut. The stylist did not wash her hair at all before tearing into it with scissors. The entire appointment the stylist complained that he hair was "too thick" and did not stop complaining about how my moms hair "just wouldn't cooperate." At the end of the appointment, my mom did not receive the cut she wanted at all, it was a jagged uneven cut. My mom had beautiful long hair and now the cut was so short that even if she wanted to have it fixed at another salon, it would turn into a pixie which is NOT what she wanted. For me, thankfully she didn't botch my hair like my mom but still she was rude and complained that my hair was "just as thick as my moms" I already have a pixie so there wasn't much she could mess up on thank God. At checkout, the stylist even scowled at the fact that i was paying for my moms cut along with my own! as if its unheard of for a daughter to treat her mother on her birthday! Needles to say I left a small tip to be nice because the cuts were not that expensive but honestly i shouldn't have. My mom was so upset that night when we went to dinner and did not feel confident :(

name: Daniel Stokes
text: This place is horrible. I made an online appointment friday for 10:15 on saturday. Got there early and waited till 10:10 to go to the door. When i got there she said I was not on the schedule and that the online service double books and they have to cancel the overbooked. She said i would have gotten an email about the cancelation, but i never got one. They are cancelling people and only taking the ones they want.

name: Faith Perry
text: I got my hair cut here today and I absolutely love it. Just upset with what I had to pay. When I called and went in I said both times that I just wanted an adult hair cut. After cutting, she said she needed to completely dry my hair to make sure it was all cut right. I said that was fine and she used a blow dryer to dry it. When I went to check out she charged me 15.99 for the hair cut and then 17.99 for "styling" my hair. I asked what that was for since I only wanted a hair cut and she said for blow drying my hair. I didnt understand why blow drying my hair was more than the hair cut itself and I was upset that she didn't tell me it would cost to blow dry my hair. Still very happy with how my hair looks. I am just upset with how a service was done and charged without telling me first because I would have said to not dry it.

Thank you!

text: I have been for my last two haircuts and I have never posted a review on a hairstylist before. However Rochelle is hands down my favorite hairstylist I have ever been to. She's attentive, nice and really seems to care about what you want and making it work for you. I usually am nervous to get my haircut and nervous to have to force a conversation with my hairstylist but I never feel that way with Rochelle. Cost Cutters needs to give Rochelle a raise asap. Thanks Rochelle, and see you soon! c:

name: Tawney Williams
text: This place is wonderful if you have a easy quick haircut to get. Especially for a child. The price is amazing! You can't beat that. But don't expect them to be a stylist. If you know what you want and it's a basic haircut go here.

name: Shea
text:
Do yourself a BIG FAVOR,  do not go to any of these "chain-store" Salons..! 🚫💇🏻
I have heard nothing but horror stories 🏃💨✂.  I paid almost $100💰 for them to BURN OFF my hair to the point where even my ROOTS were PERMANENTLY DAMAGED and no longer grow hair. 👎🙅.  That was after they decided that the haircut I wanted,  wasn't what THEY thought I needed!!😐❓
*This was a couple years ago. I STILL have to hide my thin& half-bald hair(in the front).

resp.text: We're sorry to hear this, Shea, and have shared this with our local Guest Services team. Thank you for letting us know. We strive to provide a quality salon experience every time you visit. If you are interested in discussing this with a District Leader, please contact 1-800-345-7811 or departmentcs@regiscorp.com. Thank you.

name: Kelly Speigner
text: When calling, they pick up the phone and hang up.  Repeatedly.

resp.text:
Kelly -
We're sorry to hear this - thank you for letting us know. The fastest way to share your feedback with the local salon management team is by submitting the Customer Care form on our website: https://bit.ly/2YBQ2Jp
Thank you!

name: Beth H.
text: Kitty at this location is fantastic! This is the only place go to get my haircut now. I brought in pictures, she used those ideas and makes it work for my hair type. Everyone there is nice and it's always clean. Definitely recommend it!

name: Brianna Harris
text: Ms. Rochelle is very knowledgeable about hair as well as healthy hair products that compliment your individual needs. She is such a pleasant and warm hearted woman. My daughter absolutely loves her!

name: robydean7
text: Friendly staff, good haircut.

name: Ilesha Shiver
text: Rochelle is the best! I won’t see anyone but her. She’s friendly and does great work.

name: Geoffrey Hennies
text: Been going there for years, Kitty does a great job with my hair, and I am sure the rest of the stylists are great too. Very friendly upbeat atmosphere!

name: B14nk
text: They cut my sons hair and it always looks nice but every single time we have ever been we have to wait. Usually an hour or so. One time 2 hours. And it's not like they are slammed. The stylists take forever to cut your hair. Also one time the lady mispronounced my sons name, Micah, she said Makiya. I wasn't paying attention, I just know I never heard Micah.  We were skipped and had to wait even longer.

name: Tamara Stinson
text: Rochelle is amazing with my boys! They love coming to get their hair cut & having her style it for them.

name: Dayzohnuh McMiller
text: I am a frequent customer and Mrs.Roshelle does my hair all the time and I love how patient she is and how she takes her time with her work!

name: Billy Dease
text: If you want the best haircut in town, then Cost Cutters of Dothan Alabama is the place to be..

name: Edith Berglund
text: Great with children and they make your hair look amazing

name: Kats positively world Kat
text: Mrs. Rochelle is a hair goddess . I come to her for all my hair needs . Such a fun filled  environment I bring my whole family . Thanks love !

name: PC Firearms
text:
Showed up at this place as a walk-in Sunday afternoon and not a single person in the store for a simple shaved haircut. the lady helping me answered the phone while she is conversing with me and promptly penciled someone in for 45 minutes ahead. Then told me I would have to wait 30 minutes for the next stylist to come off break because she wouldn’t have time to finish before the call in arrived. Left very dissatisfied.
Fast forward to the next day Monday . I get there at 6:15 and the stylist is finishing up a haircut with no one else in line and told that she was closing up for the rest of the night when their posted hours state they are open until 7pm.

I definitely can’t comment on the quality of their haircuts because it seems you have to call 4 days in advance and wait an hour to even get one.
Will definitely  not get another shot at my business ever again.

name: Joel Munoz III
text:
It's hit or miss. Depending on the stylist, you're either going to have a great haircut or a terrible one. The staff can be very friendly or you can walk in and they're rude as heck.

Scenario: i walk in "i was hoping to get my sons hair cut today"
girl looks at me like shes frustrated and says "well, you gonna have to come back"
me" "ok, no problem, is there a specific time?"
her: "yeah, 5:30"
This was 20 mins after opening on a Saturday. Maybe it was too early in the morning to be polite. I wont go back, considering there are TONS of other places people can go for haircuts in this town you would think they wouldn't be rude.

resp.text:
Joel, We're sorry to hear this and thank you for letting us know. We have shared this with our local Guest Services team. We strive to provide a quality salon experience every time you visit.
If you are interested in discussing this with a District Leader, please contact 1-800-345-7811 or departmentcs@regiscorp.com. Thank you.

name: Patricia Smiley
text: I Love  Rochelle.  She always does me good!

name: Robert Tatum
text: Friendly stylists, great prices, and no long waits thanks to online check-in ✔

name: Sarah Routzong
text:
I made an appointment for  11:00 a.m., three days in advance, for a cut, blow out and style.  Well, I was running a few minutes late this morning, seeing as I have an infant to care for and showed up at exactly 11:03 a.m.  My stylist, whom is also the MANAGER told me she went ahead and took a walk-in because I was ALMOST five minutes late.  By now, it is 11:04.  After this, she tells me she "may"have time to squeeze in a cut, blow dry and style.  I waited until 11:22 to have my hair done and styled poorly.  Needless to say, I will not be making another appointment at Cost Cutters ever again.

P.S. Cost Cutters...If you want to build a solid customer base, consider being respectful to your future clients.  Peace.

name: Ray Carney
text: Have gone to the same lady for years (Kitty) and she is always friendly, polite and efficient.

name: Joan Danley
text: Only let Rochelle cut your hair.  Anyone else will butcher it .   I am so disappointed in this place.  I won't go back.

text: Been getting my haircut here for years I'm military so they give discounts for military this place is always clean and people are friendly I enjoy getting my haircut here way better than going to the mall for sure

So if you are reading this go right down the road to Sport Clips they will solve all your hair needs!

text: Some very good hair experts in this shop who are always courteous.

name: Jessica Thrasher
text: Went today & ended up leaving. The chick with the pink hair was scatter brained ("n'stuff") & obviously did not care that we were waiting. She took her time & tended to other unimportant things as we sat and waited in disbelief that she had no respect for our time. Even after an hour, we decided if those people had such little respect for us we weren't going to trust them with my 10 year old sons hair. I wouldn't even give them one star. A complete waste of our time. There must be a real adult responsible for this business & I hope they know they let airheads run it.

name: Shawn Keeney
text: I love coming here...Erin is the best!! I highly recommend her! Very friendly, professional and takes her time to make sure she gets it right...

name: Brian Ordway
text: I have been to the north side location dozens of times now and every time the young ladies working have been very nice. Quick service and good haircuts.

name: Chris Green
text: Never had a bad experience here. This is the only place I go to get my hair cut any more.

name: Barbara Prewett
text: Was just there .. very pleasant and helpful

name: Charlie Dykes
text: Don't call them and expect them to take you close to closing time. I got to their place 10 til close for just a simple haircut and they turned me away after saying the time was fine over the phone. Might have saved me from a bad haircut. Thank you God.

name: Kyle Dansby
text: I have tried several different places and Cost Cutters being one. I have tried Cost Cutters beside Publix twice and have been very disappointed in the customer service and the quality of the cut. They did not provide a rinse after my haircut therefore, I had to spend the rest of my day in Dothan with hair down my shirt. The straw that broke the camel's back was the last time, I went in Cost Cutters they literally cut my hair in 5 minutes and my sideburns were uneven. I asked the beautician about this and she said that they looked fine to her. When I got home I had to straighten my sideburns with Clippers myself. I will not be going back.

name: Nicole Sellers
text: So happy!!!

name: Tamara Wright
text: Great!!!!

name: Beth Brown
text: Good prices.

name: Kimmie Mack
text: I came in the door feeling average and I left feeling like a superstar ready for my next challenge! Takaya slayed my hair and my face!

name: Anita Brown
text: Today was my first visit to Miracle’s Hair Design and it won’t be my last!! The atmosphere was peaceful and fun. Mrs. Maddox performance in styling my hair felt wonderful. Do yourself a favor and book yourself an appointment today if you’re looking for excellent service for your natural tresses.

name: Jonnitha Clark
text:
If you are new to this salon, make sure you confirm the fees before service.  I expected to pay less than $100.  She charged me $310 for a sew-in bang.

When I set appointment with Miracles, I was never told $310 for less than half a head sew-in and other services.

resp.text: This is FALSE! When you called the salon you were notified of the fees and you stated with our salon manager you did not care about the pricing because you needed your hair done . Also, your services included a sew in bang, a partial relaxer , a cut, your prior sew in removed,  a shampoo and blowout, and you also purchased a Premium Virgin Hair Bundle. You received several services which led up to your total . Thank you so much for your business . I do hate that you were unhappy with the prices but  no salon will give you all of those services for under a $100. I am glad you were very pleased with how your hair turned out .  God bless you !

name: Char J
text: Poor quality hair that has a smell to it. Sew in are not worth the price. I got a sew in on the 13 of October, 15 days later I’m ready to take out.

resp.text: Hello , thank you for your review . However, Our hair is top quality and ALL of our clients LOVE our hair bundles . They last and they are quality! You are more than welcome to call and comeI in and give me the opportunity to right any wrong you feel you might have experienced. This review is inconsistent with our other reviews  and it is NOT true . Thank you!

name: Taccara Curry
text: Love to e atmosphere and the stylist gave me what I ask for. Love my hair

name: tonitia thompson
text: San was very nice, knowledgeable and professional. I love my color and cut. I appreciated how she wasn't scared to do my natural 4a hair.  Will be booking with her again

name: Kay Anderson
text:
Absolute best stylus in town. I am natural, and have been there for silk presse, hair coloring, trimmings, sew in’s with closures, etc,  and Takaya can truly slay some hair.  it’s common for me to walk in there with my hair flying in every direction, and boy let me tell you, once T is finished, I could give Beyoncé a run for her money. Highly recommend and she will and always be my stylist for life. Go give her a try. You will absolutely not be disappointed. If I could give Takaya more than five stars,  I would. Happy client always.
Kentreene

name: Dr. LaToya Ifill
text: Takaya was amazing . I came  in with my hair in shambles. She made me look absolutely beautiful. The atmosphere in the shop is very personable.

name: Gab L.
text: Loved it! This is my new salon, not only did have get service but my stylist was very knowledgeable and informative about caring for my natural hair. It is definitely be worth the trip.

name: Katrice Aldridge
text: Love it!! TaKaya has a true gift!! Definitely deserves a 10 🌟! I found my new stylist!

name: LaSharn Faush
text: I love the professional atmosphere and the quality hair care provided by owner and stylist Takaya Cunningham Maddox. I love the body and bounce my natural hair has after visiting the shop. Most people think I still have a relaxer.  I would recommend Miracles to anyone who desires to rock their natural texture. Its not only doable, it's manageable! Visit Miracles for healthy, high end hair!

name: Tara Garner
text: Miracle's Hair Design is a very organized and professional place of business. The employees are very friendly, and they are great hairstylists! In addition, it is a one-stop shop for hair and makeup. This is my go to place when I want to be the best looking female at any event, and when I have to do a photo shoot.

name: Tonya Clarke
text: Miracle Hair Salon is truly a “miracle”. I have been a client of Miracle’s for over 10 years ; I have never been disappointed. Very friendly, professional and family oriented environment. I’ve always been happy and pleased with the ending results and service. If you want a professional and healthy look, checkout “Miracles ’s “.

name: Mrs. Jen H
text: The Master stylist does great work on natural hair.

name: Lavinnie Collins
text: I appreciate the quick appointment & services. My services were for relaxer, cut & curl. My hair was cut & styled the way I wanted, but my hair is thin & I asked for tracks to make my hair full, not black spray! I just left the shop & made it home back to Tuscaloosa washing my hair because this black spray all over my hand. I have to try to find someone to do my hair tomorrow!

name: Stacy Vann
text: Extremely Lovely Women and Excellent Service. I definitely recommend this establishment.

name: Leticia Orcutt
text: Great place and my hair looks really great but I wish I would have said not so tight on the braiding on the edges. Its  soooo tight! But can't fix it moes im going out of town.

name: Shakina Dixon
text: I live this place and the people are wonderful especially San!!

name: Nikki B
text: They are nice people but they don't specialize in natural hair. The Beautician Eco styling gel in my hair didn't oil it or put anything to protect my hair before putting Eco in it. I was totally disappointed in the results.

resp.text: Hello I truly apologize that you were not fully satisfied with your hair services.  Please allow us the opportunity to fix it.  Give us a call at your earliest convenience.  Thank you again for your business!

name: Annette Towner
text: I am so grateful to know Takaya especially when I started taking care of my mom. She made her feel and look beautiful every time we were here. Mom use to say she spends a lot of time on your hair and it always looks good

name: Sharon McCray
text: Nice, friendly, and professional atmosphere. Hair looked amazing!

name: Jasmine George
text:
Every visit for the last 16 years had been awesome. I never have to worry about not liking my hair; its always Flawless.
I love my Miracle stylist!

name: LaKesha Douglas
text: Professional and friendly atmosphere. I am very happy with my service and the stylist/owner who took very good care of my needs. I will be returning frequently.

name: LIVING LIFE
text: Today was my first time at this salon and I am a satisfied customer! Takaya is very talented at what she does and takes her time perfecting her craft. She is very knowledgeable about hair and  her foundation braiding for my sew in was impeccable. I would definitely recommend her for any service! She even slayed my brows! I drove 3 hours from Metro Nashville to experience the "miracle" that Takaya performed upon my head.

name: Kernesha Weatherly
text: Definitely my favorite place. I have been going for almost 15 years and I cant say enough good things about this place. Takaya is very talented and has always done a good job with my hair. When I decided to transition to Natural, Takaya helped me with the transitioning until I was ready for the big chop. After that, I literally just switched chairs and Carla has maintained my hair since then. They take their time and they protect your edges. Whether you are natural or relaxed, I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Kris Hayes
text: I saw a girl at my job and her hair was life. I asked who did her hair and she told me Makaya at Miracles Hair Design. I proceeded to make an appointment at that moment and I must say I have absolutely no regrets. I have been coming here for about 6 months now and every single experience has been nothing but spectacular. My hair is always on point . The wait is not outrageous and the service is excellent. I've been looking for a great stylist for a while and I can honestly say I've found her. Do yourself a favor and make an appointment ASAP

text: New to Birmingham and was in search of a salon for my natural hair. Found this salon and love it! I went for a silk press/trim: Kaya was very kind and took the time to gently detangle with my tangled hair and explained the process and maintenance tips. The salon is also very comfortable environment. Would recommend!

name: Angela Washington
text: My daughter got her sew in today and she will love it. The owner and her family is very down to earth and it was a great experience.

I got there and didn't even get in the door properly and the guy approached my children b4 me rudely. I was told, he wasn't the one I talked to and he can't have too many people in the shop.

text: Truly talented barbers! I travel a lot and been to dozens of barbershops. I used to think that you can only get an exceptional skin fade from barbers in big cities... I would wait until I was in Baltimore, DC, Atlanta, Detroit... Now I always get a haircut here at Distinguished Clippers before leaving out of town!

name: Jessica Farrell

text: George and Tony.....what can i say.....you keep me with the tight razor sharp lines. The only barbers i go see!

resp.text: Thanks Johnathan really appreciate you. Down since day one

name: Clay Rollins
text:
I have been seeing George for over two years now, and with most barbers in the past I’ve always had to go home and finish up, due too missed hairs on my neck, beard ETC..

WITH DISTINGUISHED CLIPPERS, that does NOT happen.. I leave thrilled with my new haircut every time I walk out of his doors. I will never go to another barber again

name: Melinda Stiles
text: I take my boys to this barber shop george does an awesome job my boys always walking out looking handsome and fresh. I love how he can just look at them and know what cut they want or need. Distinguished clippers top notch best barbershop i have ever been at. I can only say good things about this shop. Everyone who works there so nice and professional they make you feel very welcome.

name: Greg Perrine
text: Amazing barbers! George and Tony will make sure you look your very best. Great atmosphere. Check them out you will not be disappointed.

name: Sara Hardin
text: Anthony does such a good job! We took my grandson for his very first cut! He was so patient with him

name: Matthew Warren
text: Best place in South Huntsville to get a beard shaped up. Ruby has experience from Roosters. She cuts my 4 year old boy and girl's hair too. Good movie-like  Barbershop experience.. good times and has been a great little secret.

name: Ray Brown II
text: Hands down the best barber I've ever had in my life! I met George (the owner) 3 years ago and NO ONE else has cut my hair since we met. No one can meet the quality and attention to detail that George has shown since I have known him. I always get compliments after leaving Distinguished. I go about every 2 weeks and get the full service, hair, beard, hot towel, and carrot oil. George is a professional that gives the customer exactly what they want. Keep it up G!

name: Patrick Braden
text: Great barber and great atmosphere. He will listen to how u want a cut and then knock it out the park.

name: Chantell Johnson
text: Mr. T is what me and my boys like to call Tony. Comfortable atmosphere plus skill is the winning combo. The boys always leave with their confidence on 10!

name: Trey Robbins
text: I have known George for many years before he opened his own shop. I was happy to make the switch to Distinguished Clippers great haircuts and reasonable prices. George, Ruby, and Tony are the best you can not go wrong with getting a haircut from anyone on the team.

name: andrew ausin
text: Hands down best haircut I’ve ever gotten. Went to George about a year ago for the first time. I had never had anything done with straight razor. This isn’t your in and out in 10 minutes quick cut. You will be looking in the mirror after you leave admiring the detail that goes into it. I’ve sent a couple people up to distinguished clippers and will continue to do so.

name: Jess
text: We were approached in the parking lot by the owner (going to the convenience store) and the gentlemen made comment to my husband to come try them out. We had no idea there was a barber shop there. So he decided to go a few weeks later and I can't Express the gratitude we have for the treatment and service given. I've been telling my husband for years a barber is where it's at and true enough. Excellent hair cut and beard trim. Very professional and clean. He looks amazing. Thank you so much and will continue to repeat business and spread the word!

name: Wynn Knowles
text: I have followed George for a few years now. He started out at some big name barber shops in town, and now has his own place. His style is still fresh, and his work is still the best in Huntsville, in my opinion. I have never been disappointed. He gives a solid fade and a clean beard trim. He's an awesome guy and it shows through his professionalism. The name says it all. Distinguished.

name: Keara Cook

Will definitely go back.  :-)

name: Lauren Blackmon
text: As a woman, I absolutely HATE taking my son to the barbershop thus my son has not had a haircut in FOREVER. But I met the owner of Distinguished Clippers and he assured me that this shop was an environment that I would feel welcomed and a shop that would provide an amazing haircut for my son.... and boy was he right!!! Very very clean and welcoming establishment and all the barbers were friendly and professional and my son absolutely loves his haircut. Awesome place in South Huntsville! Thanks guys!! You've got a new customer for sure.

name: Andrew Bacon
text:
Been getting my haircut by owner George Stiles for the past 2 years now and I am always satisfied. If you are sick of going to corporate haircut joints like Great Clips or Roosters who give you the typical talking points with inconsistent results then give Distinguished Clippers a visit!
George is a professional, personable guy who has an uncanny ability to remember exactly how you like your cut to be and, most importantly, has an eye for detail. Not to mention he does a legit hot towel, straight razor shave for all you baby faces like me ;) and if George isn't available, his partner Anthony Fuqua is just as talented a Barber, check them out!

Not to mention, the cuts he gives are top notch. Lots of attention to detail. Every time I go in for a cut, I know I'm going to come out looking--as George would say--distinguished.

text: Just got a cut this morning. Fantastic quality as always.Great atmosphere and guys. Definitely reminds me why I don't go anywhere else. #prideofownership

name: Shane Suttles
text: Well, today was my first time at this shop. I received the worst haircut I could have gotten for my first experience! The staff is super friendly but being friendly don't get peoples hair cut properly. I'm a white guy and I mention this because I never let white people or women touch my head. Well, when I walked in there was a black dude (Tony), and a white lady (Ruby). Tony had one guy in his chair and one guy waiting on him. Ruby asked if I needed a cut and I should have told her, "no offense, but I'll wait on Tony and then explained why." I thought about it for a second, and if I hadn't been in a hurry to get to a job interview I would have waited or went somewhere else. So I said sure. As soon as I sat down, I told her that I wasn't trying to be rude in saying this, but I haven't let a white person touch my head in 18 years, and I haven't let a woman touch my head since I was a kid. Obviously she covered both categories. I told her it's because black and Spanish dudes can fade hair great! Now, she's already gotten started at this point and she proceeds to tell me that she probably isn't as good as the owner, George and Tony. -RED FLAG- (the only two black guys that cut here) She follows that up with, "I'll get you Tony's card, and you can call him for a cut the next time you come." -RED FLAG- She even told me that she's good with lining up beards as well. Spoiler Alert!!! She lied about both!!! Again, she's very nice, but being nice doesn't get my hair cut correctly! Well, I guess you know where this is going! She F'd my head up son!!! And my beard, mannnnnnnn let me tell you. She must have closed her eyes or something when she was lining my beard up. I literally had to tell her that I looked like I had a bowl cut, that she needed to fade it better and more on the sides. Told her I hadn't had a bowl cut since I was a small child and my mom couldn't afford to get me a real descent haircut. She tried to fix it with no luck at all. (Because there was no skill!) She finished that and then moved on to my beard. This woman put a hot towel on my face, which felt nice, but I'm at a barber shop, not a salon, to get my damn hair cut! She then proceeds to attempt to line my beard up, and she must have closed her eyes, took her glasses off, or just looked away when she got to this part because my line on my neck seriously looked like she held me down and trimmed it with a weed wacker! She put a different hot towel on my face and then told me we were almost done that she needed to put a cold towel to close my pores and I was like, "No ma'am!" we are done! Now I'm at the point where I am to pay for my services, or lack thereof, and she proceeds to tell me that my hair cut and beard line up was $40!!! Needless to say, she DID NOT GET A TIP!!! Needless to say, don't let her even look at your head, and get Tony. He at least looked descent from what I could see while sitting next to him getting mutilated! I'm sorry, I'm not trying to be mean, but I take my hair and beard cuts VERY seriously!!! (If you couldn't tell by now) Enter at your own risk. Oh, I gave it two stars because they're really nice peeps but some should seek out new professions. Peace. Sorry Tony

name: Dkhaired Angel
text:
I went into the salon and asked for a haircut.   The advertised price was $12.95 w/ shampoo.   I was taken to a chair and doused with a spray bottle of water, and given a haircut!  I was sent out the door with semi wet hair and no offer to style what so ever!  In my opinion this is unprofessional.   Being a retired hairstylist I would never have let my client walk into my salon and not shampoo the hair and make an offer of a style to my client.   As a client I shouldn't have to beg or request a service that is offered for a set price, this is pure laziness.

My cut was good but you would never know it from the way my hair looked when I left the salon.   I certainly wasn't a very good advertisement for this stylist or the salon!

name: Heather Craig
text: NEVER AGAIN WILL I GO. I got a hair cut from Ealissa and I absolutely HATE it! I specifically brought in a picture of what I wanted, and she turned me away from the mirror and basically cut my hair however she wanted with NO REGARD to the picture I brought in. My hair is literally 6" shorter than what I asked for, and when I told her that, NO APOLOGY. She basically told me that in the picture, the girl had extensions and that's why mine was so much shorter. And then said that it shrank because it was wet. She chopped all of it off without even asking anything. I cried for two hours. The boss was very nice, and refunded my money, but now I am stuck with a hair cut that I absolutely hate until it grows out. There's also a HUGE gap in the back where she cut part shorter than the rest. The point of the picture was so I could have the style and the length, and she completely did what she wanted. Every time I see all my hair gone, I cry again. I had waist length hair, and she cut it up to my jaw instead of below my collar bone. If I could give 0 stars I would. I could go on and on about how upset I am with what I ended up with, and the fact that Ealissa made NO EFFORT to fix her mistake.

Went here to get my daughter's dead ends trimmed and the lady Alicia made my daughter look like Dora the explorer and she went in looking like Alicia Keys. Major difference slightly exaggerating about the Alicia Keys but my point is she said she cut an inch off because she only had about an inch of dead ends. She literally cut like 2 1/2 - 3 1/2 inches and I have the pics to prove it. So disappointed never again. We will never go here again. Not to mention the integrity issue my had straightened my daughters hair before coming in and she wet it after she was done so it curled up and was less noticeable about how much she had actually cut. My daughter has really tight curls straighten it's below her shoulder blades, curled shoulder length or a little longer now she literally looks like Dora.

Last night I got there at 5:55 (they close at 7:00). No customers in the chair or waiting. She appeared to be talking with friends in the back room. She never came around to the front of the salon. She only looked at me through the mirrors.  When she asked what I needed, (a basic kids cut) she told me it would be at least 30 mins. I asked is she could put our name on the list and I would go pick-up the Walmart items I needed first and she said no, that I could just check back with her in 30 mins.
I called the Jacksonville store that she immediately got us in even though she also had other people waiting.  Will continue to use Jacksonville but do not waste your time in Lenlock!!!!!

name: Jeff Watson
text: I rarely give a poor review. Don't waste your time going to the shop inside Wal-Mart on Montgomery highway Dothan Alabama. They will tell you they close in thirty minutes and don't have time. I'm ok with that. Just put a sign up instead of just watching me stand there waiting. You had other stylist just waiting for 7pm. I miss the days when a business would earn the business of every customer who walked through the door even if it was last minute. 30 minutes isn't exactly last minute but who am I to decide.

Thanks for sharing your experience with us, Jeff. We apologize for the inconvenience and have shared your review with our Guest Service team.

name: Tabreena Eubanks
text:
Came in asked to get my hair dyed. The manager then asked me, what is one your head? It had been some times since I had dyed my hair. I explained that it had been box over 2 months. She then publicly proclaimed infornt of everyone, even getting in my face, I WILL not dye your hair. I will not put my name on your head because I have nothing to cover...that. the public thinks they can just do whatever to their hair. I wont do it.
Embarrased and upset I left. I was shocked to learn that stylist DO infact dye hair that has been boxed and will even fix a mess up.
I do not recommend this salon! Lord knows if the manager acts like this what a joke her staff must be!

resp.text:
Tabreena, we're sorry to hear this - thank you for letting us know. We strive to provide a quality salon experience every time you visit, and we have shared your experience with our local Guest Service team.

If you are interested in discussing this with a District Leader, please contact 1-800-737-3535 or departmentcs@regiscorp.com.

name: Leslie Ann
text: I will never go here ever again!! I recommend no body to go here. First of all I have long hair, I wanted my split ends off and layered along with face layered. All she did was a face layered and split ends, and then she took a big round tool for the hair dryer and tried to curl up my hair, when I got home, my husband looked and they burned some of my hair so not only was my hair the same, just a snip here and there, but it stayed frizzy all the time, no matter what I did it would still frizzy. So I finally went to options in my town and they did my hair right. My mom went the same day I had mine done at Walmart, this same place. The girl who did hers, was suppose to cut her split ends off and layer it. She did 2 snips on 1 side and the other side and she was done. Then they changed their prices from 15$ (for a wash and cut along with druing) to 20$ for a wash, cut and dry. It's still 15$ for a cut and wash, but you will have to go around with wet hair because in order to dry, you have to pay 5$ more. Oh but they don't tell you that at the counter BTW!! Wound up paying almost 45$ for mine and my mom's hair cuts. They would not refund either. So I could have let my 10yr old niece cut my hair way better than those people and saved 45$. I will never go back. I suggest to anyone else, if you want to goto your salon who does a good job, but decides oh I'm at Walmart, I'll just do it here, don't! Go ahead make an appointment or walk in at your fav salon. Save your money.

name: Linda Marshall
text: I was desperate for a color correction and overall hair makeover. After checking out their reviews, I chose Kreative Kuts. I am happy to say that my experience was absolutely wonderful!!' Kim took sincere time with me to choose a color, style and introduced me to several new things that I had not heard of. I decided to do the Brazilian blowout at the time of my color and cut. She patiently and joyfully worked on my LONG hair for hours even staying late to give me the most amazing hair I've had!!  She never rushed or cut any corners to hurry, she continued to take time and make certain that everything was done correctly. I am so excited to have a new do and a new hair stylist. She is definitely a color specialist and the entire staff was very professional, qualified, talented as well as friendly. They can do eyelash perms, Brazilian blowout, and sell all the fine Paul Mitchell products, not to mention, new and interesting tools. I give them a 10 plus!!! Oh and the other great part was the price, they were so reasonable for the services they perform and their main goal is to make sure you are completely satisfied when you leave!! Thank you Kim and P.J and I will see you again in August!!!!

name: Jamie Perry
text: My whole family goes to Creative Kuts & Styles Hair Salon and Beauty Shop. My Mum and I love that the hairdressers go to the Nashville and other hair shows to learn how to do the latest cuts, colors and styles (my Dad and brother don't care as much - they just get the same men's barber hair cut each time). I worked at a beauty parlor years ago and I can tell you that I've never seen hair stylists or beauticians that care as much as Kim and her team. I have very long hair that I dread cutting but the girls take off only what is necessary. I alternate between hair straightening and letting the  hairdressing salon tame it all perfectly into loose wavy curls. Every six weeks I like to get a deep conditioning keratin treatment and multidimensional highlights and Kim is the best at listening to and giving me exactly what I want. I love that I can buy all of my fav Paul Mitchell, A.R.C.O.N and Olez hair and beauty supplies here too. For Mothers Day, I treated my Mom to some corrective hair coloring (these guys are master colorists) and a new textured bob that she absolutely adores and a relaxing pedicure too. We have booked them to do all the hair updos for my bridal party in mid-June. I've seen some of their wedding hairstyles on instagram and am so excited.

text: New Lookz is a very nice, clean salon I was relieved when I walked in to observe their cleanliness during COVID. Jennifer did my hair and she knew as soon as I walked in that I was a bit nervous coming to a new salon. She did an amazing job from the start to end, and did a gorgeous color and style on my hair. I have not been to a salon in over a year so my hair definitely needed the TLC and that’s exactly what I got. I feel so blessed to have found her, she gave me exactly what I wanted and I just have not had a stylist do that in forever!!! Don’t be nervous, trust her and you’ll walk out happy!!

name: Tofu McNooch
text:
The entire staff here is great. No one has a big ego, and they support and assist each other to make sure clients get what they want. Jen FIXXXEDDD my hair. I have very long hair that I tried to dye myself, light brown to ginger red. Big mistake. Hot roots, a total mess. I lived out of state and went to a local salon to fix it. They made it look more even and it improved, but it still wasn't the color I wanted. I moved here and found New Look. Jen really took the time to get my color exactly how I wanted it. It was a long salon day, with deep conditioning, all-over lightening, and a toner that made it perfect. I wanted a bright, orange-y/copper, natural ginger look. SHE.DID. IT. All of this was done WITHOUT damaging my hair--and it was a pretty drastic change. I've had my hair lightened before, and there was always a period of super-dry, frizzy straw hair that took weeks of deep conditioning to recuperate. This is not the case now. My hair doesn't even feel like it's been colored at all. It's just as healthy as it was from the start. Also, I now get complements on my hair E-V-E-R-Y day. That's never happened to me before! It's in the name, y'all: New Look.

If you're looking to srrsly upgrade your hair, go here.

resp.text: We really appreciate so much we aim to please.  It was such a pleasure getting to know you and giving us the honor of slaying your hair.

resp.text: I do want to start off by apologizing that your experience with us wasn’t up to your standards. Had I been made aware that the haircut you received was not what you asked for I would have gladly worked with you to come up with a resolution, unfortunately I am just now being made aware with this review. Most of my barbers are bilingual as we service everyone in the community, if there is ever a language barrier with the barbers whose English is not perfect I myself or any of  the barbers who are fluent in English are always willing to translate to ensure that the barber and the client understand each other. I hire great barbers regardless of the language they speak. Again I do apologize, please next time make me aware of the issue so I can fix it in that moment, and I appreciate you taking the time to give us feedback.
