name: Matthew Golia
text:
I just relocated to the Birmingham area and was in need of a Great haircut. Staying at the residence inn, I Googled best barber near me, and Robert Henry popped up first. Took a look at a few reviews and then booked my appointment online for just a few hours later.

Robert Henry is located inside the Sola Salons community of beauty care, which is a series of suites that are rented by different beauty experts. Walking into the solo suite, I was met by Robert who was gratious and welcoming, as was his work space. Very clean, with a modern feel, Robert started with a brief consultation, asking me what I was looking for, as well as assessing my hair's style. He made some brief suggestions and offered up a bottled water and then we were off.

I signed up for the business cut. From moment one I knew I made the right choice. Shampoo, a little massage and then he dives right into his craft. Robert was talkative and engaging while never being overbearing, he had a comforting chair side manor, and walked me through what he was doing, like a play by play.

His style is precise and you know, even if you can't see, that you are being treated to a Great haircut. Once he had finished with the overall styling, he conditioned and treated me to a warm face towel. Man, what a touch. A brief scalp massage and then he popped me back up, applied some product and I get the glimpse of the final product. It is Amazing. He shows me the back, where he tiered it a little more in the lower section, remembering how I told him that section grew faster than other spots. Love the attention to detail.

I highly recommend Robert Henry. I have a pretty wild mane, curly in spots, straight in others and some pretty crazy hairlines, and they were no match for this amazing stylist.

Mahalo & Namaste,

mpgink

text:
Had some coupons and the were really great about honoring 3 at one time. I know most places won't do this. My two sons and I all got haircuts at the same time.

When we got there, the wait time was short. I was on a booth within 5 minutes and my two sons were just a couple minutes behind me. Both my sons look great and are very happy with their cuts and styles. My 20 year old actually loves his new style.

The stylist cutting my hair did a great job. Even when I kept asking her to cut it a little shorter. After everyone was done, the stylist all recommended products for us. They had the Crew Tea Tree oil product I love. They also recommended a cream for 10 year old to use with his new style.

The only reason for a 4 star was the stylist cutting my hair made no effort to have a conversation. It was kind of a boring time. Other than that, everything was great. Will be going back.

I don’t ever write reviews, but I’m ticked.
The website says that this place is welcoming to women despite it being marketed toward men, and I had a coupon, so I thought I’d give it a try. I’m currently trying to grow my hair out from a pixie cut, so I just wanted an inch taken off of the part by my neck and a very slight all around trim. Apparently they have no clue what trim means because she took off nearly 3/4 of an inch all over. When you’re growing your hair out, that’s a big deal! Great Clips does a better job, and hey are cheaper than this place. Am not going back and would not recommend any other women do either. They have no clue what they’re doing with women’s hair no matter the length. Don’t let them mess yours up, too.

text: I've been to Regis 3 times for color.  The first time I went to Rikki, and she did a good job.  I didn't have any complaints.  Then I called back to get my roots done and was told she'd left, so I got an appointment with Jay--he really didn't know what he was doing.  My hair came out the right color, but it was crispy.  Then, since it is a good location for me, I decided to try a third time with a different stylist.  I got Susan who didn't fry my hair and got it to the right color in places, but she was so sloppy with the foils large chunks weren't colored.  And then the haircut she did was ridiculous.  I went somewhere else to get it fix and the next hairstylist described it as 3 different haircuts.  You might get lucky and find someone good at Regis, but overall the skill and professionalism you expect for that price point just isn't there.

text: I went in first and just got highlights even though my roots were growing out. My fault honestly. I went back the next day and Rikki was kind enough to redo my hair for only the difference of the price between the highlights and the all over cover. It was perfect. I walked out with a completely new color and I am very satisfied and very happy with the job. And Rikki is the greatest joy to chat to while you're getting your hair done. Very lovely place I'm definitely going back.

text: Rikki is my all-time favorite stylist! She always understands how I want my hair done, even though I don't bring pictures. I usually get highlights and they are always flattering. My friends always complement my hairdo,and some have become her customers. I hope I can always have Rikki my hairdresser.

name: Alyssa Dean
text: This happened like a year ago but nonetheless I will still review this salon and why I’ve never been back. So I had made an appointment 2 weeks prior to my prom. I specifically stated when I booked my appointment that it was going to be for my prom and I wanted a braid and my hair curled. This mall is 45 mins away from me and I only booked here because I was getting my makeup done in Sephora, and then had to be back 45 mins to my hometown for my prom festivities. I was on a time crunch. I get there and I was waiting for 10 mins before someone helped me, to which they asked what I needed. I stated that I had an appointment to get my hair done for prom. I showed them the picture and neither said they could achieve the simple braid and curl. they explained that the stylist I was scheduled for had called in, but I was not informed of this until I had already made the 45 min trip. They had nothing they could do for me and I was shoo-Ed away. Will never be going back. I was in tears because I was already on a time crunch and I had specifically made that appointment at that time so I would have time to do everything else. Good thing I was able to find another salon in the mall but I was late for my makeup appointment because of the time wasted.

name: Sheena-Marie Currie
text: I went in to get my hair colored for the first time ever, an ombre hairstyle. My hair is dark brown so I was pretty nervous. The stylist I had, Rikki, was fantastic; she did an amazing job with my hair and took her time, she didn't rush at all. I'll definitely be coming back to have my hair done by her again!

First time she was able to fix a horrible hair cut from another place and the second time around she was able to add some beautiful color into my plain Jane hair and I absolutely loved it, and of course the hair cut was just as great! Definitely recommend her.

They said texturizing my hair would make my hair look bad because of the humidity ? They did nothing I asked for whatsoever, and a five year old could cut better than them. text: Checked in online like they asked, walked in to confirm that I had showed up and saw I was the second one in the queue. Sat down in my car and watched someone who was behind me in the queue go ahead of me. I sat outside the door and someone who showed up 15 minutes after me got taken in before me. I asked for the first available stylist, and now two people who were after me have gone before me. My 11 minute wait has turned into a 40 minute wait, and I am still outside waiting to get a haircut. The workers seem like nice people, I just dont understand why I am watching people go before me when they checked in and showed up after me.

text: When I go here I’m always impressed with how clean the place is. The check in is so easy even someone like me who is bad at electronics can check in without a problem. The place is very lgbt friendly which is always a great plus and every single worker there gives an excellent cut.

text: First time I went to Regis I was greeted by Liz she has a bubbly personality. She did my hair a couple of weeks ago. I was very nervous about trying to find a new person to do my hair. I have gotten so many compliments on it and it still feels good and not dry. LIz did an AMAZING job on my haircut and her blow drying is beautiful and the volume she gave me I love it all. She did everything I wanted done plus she is really good at eyebrow waxing. I will definitely go back to LIz and would recommend anyone to her.

text: I love being able to get my hair cut the way I want without any issues. I have two stylists; if one isn't available the other can get me in and they are great. I went to having really long hair for years to cutting it all off and wearing it short. I tried another shop for my 6 week cut and that didn't turn out so well. I'll stick with my stylist from now on as long as they are active and I'm in Birmingham. Thank you DeAnna and Stephen.

name: Laurie Potter
text: Jaqueline is extremely talented. She turned my fried yellow hair into something I could actually run my hands through. I had bleached my hair myself to save majority of the cost to get my hair done but over processed my hair because of my lack of knowledge. She cut off my dead ends. Completely reshaped my grown out pixie into something wearable and gave me amazing shadow roots. She’s also hilarious and adorable. Extremely smart and talented. She really knows what she’s doing

name: Jude Balcombe
text: My daughter was just horribly ripped off at the Regis Salon in the Galleria. She went in last week to have her hair colored and paid over $100. There were some spots that were missed and she asked for a touch up. She is a teen and they charged her over $300 for a TOUCH UP! She had my debit card and didn't know what to do. She paid them. A COMPLETE rip off! BEWARE!!!!

name: Susana Duran
text: I don't know what their issue was when i went with my sister, but when we asked to get our hair colored, and cut, all of them looked at us with a "why are you here, go away" looks. The guy asked two girls of they were okay with doing it, and they both said no. So after 5 minutes of just standing there, waiting for a yes or no, they told us they could not do our hair because "there is very little energy in the building". That was the excuse. Like really? I do not recommend this place for anything. Obviously they prefer white clients, then any other race, because a white woman was able to get her hair done, and we weren't. Just go else where. You'll get treated better!

text:
I actually found this place by accident in Tuscaloosa mall.

I didn't have a appointment, but a stylist by the name Mallory took me anyway and actually did a very satisfactory job. As you would probably prefer, she was friendly and very outgoing and held a good conversation to make the time pass quickly, which was far better than a boring ole' straight to business haircut. And for the record, yes everyone wore masks, the place was absolutely spotless clean and disinfected, and health safety was definitely practiced. I drove 60 miles trying to find a place to get a haircut on short notice, but for once I was satisfied all the way around and would say I'd go back regardless of the drive.

Basically money gone down the drain. Chanelle is very kind and professional. From what I saw she makes sure her clients are satisfied before leaving. name: Rob Scarveles
text: As many people know, finding a good barber is not an easy task...finding a GREAT barber is a gift from the gods!!  Upon my arrival in Huntsville,  I struggled to find a barber that was intuitive, skilled, and could do a proper clipper cut to include a straight razor finish.  After going through ~10 different barbers across town, I stumbled upon Danta and have not looked back!!  Her skills are unmatched with amazing attention to detail and pride taken in her work.  She isn't in a hurry to get you out of her chair, possessing an uncommon, meticulous approach to her work; every minute in her chair is sheer delight.  If an OUTSTANDING cut is your goal...you've discovered the right place.

text: Taylor is the best!  She is the only person I will allow to touch my hair.  I have extremely thick, curly hair and she has never done anything except ensure that I am happy and confident! I’ve sat in her chair and watched her put in extensions and then come to me and make sure I have enough layers to help thin out mane! name: Brent Heitz
text:
Follow up of review below: I’ve gotten a couple cuts since that time and they have been super nice n respectful since maybe was just a bad night but the reason I came back even after that is because there just not like anyone else around! Hands down the best cut ur gonna get within the county I promise

I set an appoint 4 days in advance n it was set for 5:30 pm I show up 15 minutes prior for time sake of course n here I am 6pm still not even sat down !!! The guy who I was scheduled with cutting this mans hair n it looked no different then it did when I walked in !! Then the customer beside him was getting his hair cut n the OWNER walks off in the middle of his haircut leaving the customer there n as I drove I see the owner sitting down at the restaurant next to the barber shop EATING !!! This is ridiculous This IS NOT THE FIRST TIME ITS HAPPENED

resp.text: Lion Homies went you give a review  make sure you're honest what you saying and sometimes we take about 5 minutes to eat because we're so busy and we don't have time to eat and we never go to eat to the restaurant next door because we do it in the Barbershop all the time but with the permission of the next client because we're respectful with the customers, We have to eat also because we're human not a machine,, do not give comments just to harm others, I am a man of God and I don't have to lie,, have a great day God bless you

name: Amanda Lee
text: I have taken my seven year old and sixteen year old here a couple of times. Two haircuts ago I took my oldest son for a fade and lineup. He came back with a rash on the back of his neck. A very painful one at that. I contacted the barber shop, and I was told he was just sensitive to the clippers and was told what to get to treat it. We have been treating it, and it had not went away and has discolored the back of his neck area.  In sixteen years my son has never gotten any rashes from barber shops. I decided to give the shop another chance,  and had thought maybe it was just a random break out. This past week I took him for a trim the rash was irritated once again, and this time there were small patches or gashes around his head and his front line were missing. My son made the statement the barber who done his hair was rushed and didnt take his time. Its unfortunate that my concern seemed to have been brushed off and in addition to that this time his hair came out even worse than before. I personally would not recommend.

text:
In the Gulf Shores area for vacation and was looking for a place that could do a decent haircut, without a vacuum hose attachment, if you know what I mean.

Hooked me up nicely, like my regular barber, - even though the appointment came through and she had to re-schedule him as to not rush me or him.

You are going to pay about $30+ for a beard and haircut, but I guess prices change based on the city you go to.

name: Jimmy McGinnis
text: I booked an appointment with this location at 7:30 am for 10:45am. I received 3 confirmations. I made arrangements at my place of work to leave early for lunch in order to make the confirmed  appointment. 15 min before I was leaving I start to print my copy to carry with me. I open my mail and they just canceled my booking. I called and the response was sorry problem with third party booking. I have no clue who they use for booking and I don't care. I care that the attitude was lacking any empathy. No attempt to fix the problem.  No offer of anything. Just a voice of let me get you off the phone ASAP. I will never come back. My Family will never come back. Anyone I can convince will never come back. I make this review knowing fully that they don't care. I only hope that anyone who reads this will save themselves the frustration of trying to deal with them. I end this rant with a question. When did customer service die in America?

name: Blaze Lawrimore
text: I originally came to this shop to be more budget conscious due to the fact that I am in college. The owner is very nice. However, one of his barbers actually fell asleep standing up while he was cutting my hair. I wish I was kidding. I could only assume he was under the influence of some substance. The haircut took one hour and the owner was fully aware that this was happening. Not only did I receive a botched haircut that the owner tried to fix, but he then proceeded to make me pay for it. This is unethical and unacceptable. It's understandable to make mistakes, but making amends is good business practice 101. Therefore, as much as I would love to support this place, I simply cannot due to poor business etiquette and poor customer service.

name: Leon Cunningham
text:
Was looking for a local barber who could actually give me the type fade I wanted the right way. Have tried nearly every barber in the shoals. Even have been to GH downtown more than once. Nobody could actually do what I wanted.

Juan did a FANTASTIC job. True high skin fade, top like I wanted, excellent beard trim and shape. Jonny came and inspected and gave his approval as well. Customer service was fantastic as was the whole experience.

I cannot recommend these guys enough. I will never go to another barber. They definitely have earned my business for life.

name: Matthew Leonardi
text: I moved here from NYC 2 years ago. I've been looking for a barber since to be as good as the one I had a New York. And I haven't found that no one even close. No one who can do good fades and nobody who does the straight blade for your lineup. Greasy hands is good in downtown but they are way overpriced and their app is just too complex for a haircut. So I decided to give up on finding a good Barber. Until I decided to go to Johnny B's. Not only was he as good as my New York Barber but he was better. Not only are they professional but they are very kind have a great conversation and most importantly they have a lot of confidence in their work. They definitely take pride which is most important. Even when he's cutting my hair and I told him about my situationE he said he guarantees it would be better then my New York Barber. Not because he knew my barber but because of his confidence. And I'll be damned it was. this guy has confidence and he knows what he's doing. I don't care what barber anyone tells you to go and Florence or anywhere in Lauderdale county for that matter. Do you want to look good? Then go to Johnny B's.

resp.text:
Thank you  Matthew   my pleasure  to serve you  here @ JonnyB Barbershop
🏅🏅🏅🏅🏅💯💈

resp.text: Thanks Jeremy for the kind words! Ariel is pretty awesome! Remember you can book online at Bullfeathershuntsville.com or download the Bullfeathers app!

name: michael chamberlain
text: I call I make an appointment I show up 10 minutes before my appointment and I still end up having to sit there and wait just so someone else can be trimmed up as I was told but then they literally cut the entire person's head. Truly felt like it was because I was white.

name: danny newton
text: Sharlene has been cutting my hair for about 3 years now. Highly recommended.

name: Billy Schofield
text: Came here for a long time... not what it used to be...  only one good barber and even his cuts are not as good as they once were... I understand people have off days but its been the last 3 times... he just acts like he doesnt want to be there and his work really shows... not to mention the wait time... there is only one person here that can give you full service, the other two just sit around and play on their phones while the guy handles 97% of their customers... not everyone has time to sit and wait 2 hours for a haircut and shave... you really need to either take appointments or hire some new help....

name: Tim Lewis
text: Waited two hours....and still did not get my hair cut! Don't go to this place!!!

name: Kolby Penton
text: Great place, great atmosphere. Nathaniel is the man to go to if you want a fade. They are insanely cheap compared to any barbers in Madison/Huntsville.

name: Maurice Ruffin
text: All I got to say is that my boy Nathaniel he will give you the hook up

name: Eirekat t
text: Reasonably priced and they do a good job. My son likes coming here to get his hair done because the barber's actually chit chat with you.

name: Kyle Edwards
text: Great shop, good atmosphere and enjoyable place to get a great haircut!!

name: Blakely Farm (Wargolem)
text: Updated the inside and good service.  Would give more stars if more than one person could do hot towel shaves.

name: Sean Ebbert
text: My barber Nathaniel is the best in a 100 mile radius and very respectful

name: Kenneth Harbin
text: Best haircut in athens

name: Levi Moss
text: 💪💪 go see Nate

name: HoBro! Inc.
text: Great place to get a haircut.

name: Fraze WRLD
text: best barber in the 256

name: L Wallace
text: Nathaniel is amazing!!

name: Storm Stevenson
text: I love this place. It's my now go too for hair cuts. Arian was professional and helped me decide on a hair style that would compliment me. She was patient and understanding at some of my hesitation (was shaving a bit of my hair, which I had never done) and was hilarious as we talked during my appointment. Friendly environment from not only her but her coworkers as well. I highly recommend!

name: Jonathan Kropp
text: I've been waiting outside for over 2 hours now during their posted hours of operation. The only consolation is a sign saying closed for lunch, but it's now past 2:00 P.M. To make it worse, somebody (owner or employee) is inside and they saw me standing outside waiting but have not come to speak to me, nor have they answered the phone in the past 3 hours (I called before coming, left after seeing the lunch sign, then came back and waited 2 hours).

name: Jaiden Pokoski
text:
Richard at Supercuts gives amazing haircuts. However I returned a few weeks ago when he was not there and got the absolute worst haircut of my life. My sideburns were cut to different lengths and were off by over half an inch. Also on the back of my head I found a chunk of hair that was completely untouched and was 2-3
Inches longer than the rest of my hair. I’m not sure how that can go unnoticed. I’ve never taken the time to write a business review but this haircut is so bad I decided it needed to be said. Even after going and getting it fixed I’m still stuck with a bad haircut that I must let grow back out before I can get another good one to fix it completely. Don’t go.

name: Mica Taylor
text: Arian is AMAZING! She got me in on a short notice and she did a great job!! She was so kind, proficient and all in all a joy to be around.

name: Meagan Franklin
text: This is the only place I will take my six year old son, as well as myself! Arian is my go-to, and she never ceases to bring my visions to life! She is thorough, patient with kids, knowledgeable, and honest about what it will take to achieve your expectations. I never have any issues, but I know that if I did- Arian and Joann would find a quick solution! They are so friendly, and I overall love the environment.

name: Wake Allen
text: Returned to this establishment to get a haircut. After the first time I went and got one of the best haircuts I’ve ever had. When I went back I got the worst haircut of my life. They had no attention to detail, and completely ruined my hair. I’m having to go somewhere else to get my hair fixed now...

name: Ashton Heuer
text: Absolutely love coming here to get my hair done! I’ve been a client here for about a year and Joann always does a fantastic job! ☺️ Very energetic and fun atmosphere! My boyfriend and his family have both been here as well and loved the outcome of their haircut styles. Always recommend to friends and family! Joann is the best!

name: Michele McQuiston
text: I love my new haircut. I went in there after an awful haircut a few months back and this is amazing. Joanna helped me. 💖

name: Jamileh Iman
text: GPS takes you to the back of the store. Confusing af!

name: landon campbell
text: Awesome staff! I have been coming here the past 3 years and don’t want to go anywhere else!

name: austin price
text: This place is one of the best places in Tuscaloosa to get a haircut. By far some of the best stylists in town, and I always leave there with a great haircut. The price is actually decent given what all they do, unlike other places in town that charge ridiculous amounts of money for the same services (aka sports clips)

name: Kassidy Giles
text: I got my hair cut by Stephanie. She did a phenomenal job and gave me exactly what I wanted, and she was the sweetest!!

name: Roll Tide Timmy
text: JoAnn is absolutely awesome! Very friendly and does an awesome job!

name: Jennifer Hudson
text: I booked a recent appointment for my husband and my son there the last Saturday of August at 3 pm. My husband went first and got a decent cut. Midway thru his cut the other stylist came and got my son. His cut took her less than 10 minutes and was the worst hack job I ever saw. I don't know know how to even begin to cut hair and even I could have done better. I was in the car trying to quarantine but my husband said she spent the whole time talking to the next family in the lobby. Even though my husband's cut started first, my son's was "done" before his was even half over. So I took my son back inside to get it fixed. They grudgingly chopped some more on the front but still left the back a mess. It sticks up on its own and is so uneven you can make out gaps.The woman who did the original hack job mentioned that we needed to update his note in his file to reflect how we wanted it cut. We have been customers at this store for years with the same notes and never have we had a problem before. I walked out then without telling her to not bother because it will be a cold day in hell before I bring my family back. Shame really since we have been repeat customers for at least a year and more.

name: Robert Holland
text: I go here regularly. The staff is always polite even when they get over booked because of walk-ins. I always come away with a great haircut and feeling refreshed by the tea tree experience. Also if you haven’t had a straight razor line up on the back highly recommended gets as close to the skin as possible and seems the hair doesn’t grow back quite as fast keeping yourself hair line in the back looking good.

name: John Burroughs
text: Great place to get a super cut. Richard always does a "super" job!

name: Ben Golden
text: Fast and very professional...in and out..BOOM

name: Charles Fields
text: Nice place. She cleaned everything before I could come back! Very impressive. Great hair cut.

name: Darrell W. Redding
text: They got me in quickly, very helpful and friendly staff, and exercising correct protocols for customer safety! 5 stars!

name: Anthony Montgomery
text: The statement from the owner read "come to this location for a quality cut at a moment's notice." I took a trip, but there was a sign on the door that read "BOOKED FOR THE DAY"

name: fabian persad
text: Make an online appt.

name: Maegan Duncan
text: Great staff and great service. Can't wait to go back.

name: Danny L
text: I usually go there bi weekly. Richard is great 👍

name: Alvin Schmidt
text: App doesn't work for appointments, so you walk in and there is 2 stylists working and 1 person waiting besides yourself, and your told you will have to wait over an hour.

name: Jenny Limbaugh
text: Love the cut and color!

name: Brock Stone
text: Fast service and friendly staff. The barber I had didn't get the haircut I showed him on my phone right. It was awful. Despite offered the discount price I just play it cool, paid, and left to another place to get the cut i wanted done from another shop nearby. I would like to point out that this isn't a bad place for Ladies' cut, but the men's cut experience was awful both visits!

name: Jack Watkins
text: Friendly service, quick, good haircuts. Located in a very central location. Can't recommend enough if you need to get a quick haircut.

name: Brooks B
text:
Supercuts, unlike other "retail" haircutterz, has never let me down. They've always been really nice and never given me a hack wacky haircut. The worst thing about Supercuts is that they advertise a happy ending (with a hot towel, get your mind out of the gutter) but sometimes forget. As disappointing as that sounds, they still get 5 stars from me. The stylist today worked around my 'covid mask' (required for now) with great skill and precision.
Last but not least, I USUALLY get a different stylist every time--yes I live on the edge--and always come out looking 'muy guapo!' Thanks Supercuts. Y'all rock!

name: Rhonda Bigham
text: Great place love my stylist jojo

name: Murali Rao
text: Poor quality haircut.

name: Lisa Bailey
text: Check in is really good now. I love being able to to check in on line. You can also just go in and get a hair cut without to much wait. They ask questions to make sure you get the right haircut for you. I can't say everyone is happy to be there, but for the most part our experience was good.

name: Crystal Gaddy
text: very friendly staff. love me some Mira. she is the one who always does my color and highlights. never disappointed with her.

name: M. Belle Hester
text: Delayed 30 minutes after appt, but Jo Ann gave great advice for hair.

name: Amanda Savage
text: My son got his hair cut here recently. Nice people, affordable, clean. He really liked his haircut. Probably wouldn't go here if you wanted a more trendy super stylized cut but great family and clean cuts.

name: Andrew Sartor
text: The staff here is friendly, but their quality of service definitely isn't great, especially at the price point. I went here because I was in a rush one day, and my usual barbershop was closed. The staff greeted me and got to me relatively quickly, especially considering the high volume of customers when I entered. After going home and looking at my new haircut, I realized why the service was so quick. They cut corners here and don't take the time to make sure you receive a high quality hair cut. My sideburns were uneven and there were multiple spots in my hair that they missed (especially around the ears). I couldn't justify returning here, especially at the cost. For less than this, you could go support a local barbershop over in Northport and receive a much better haircut.

name: Zack York
text: Amazing service! I came in on Labor Day to see Taylor for a color correction. Taylor did an amazing job at toning my hair and getting it exactly how I wanted it! She didn't stop until I was happy with it. I would highly recommend Taylor, and Supercuts for any cut or color!

name: Sam Wight
text: Great place to get a haircut! Dude who cut my hair was super friendly and gave me a really good haircut very quickly. Wait times can be high if you go on a Sunday.

name: Madaca 99
text: Went on a Thursday, only two girls there and they were both good. My son and I both got haircuts. The manager cut mine and she was a pro. The guy before me got a great looking modern cut. I just wanted mine cut short. This lady was doing a great job and I told her quit trying to do such a good cut and just chop it off. I only get my hair cut once about every 4 months and I spoiled this professional cut. She was great! She appreciated the humor and saw the practicality and still insisted on giving me a better cut that I wanted. What can you do?

name: Kelli J
text: Great service. Reasonably priced. Check in online to cut down your wait.

name: zz tan
text: Sometimes they have good haircut, Sometimes they don't

name: greg da girraffe
text: Great people, great haircuts, great prices.

name: Stephanie Keyes
text: Went Here for my first time ever and Mira did a fantastic job on my hair cut it just the way I wanted it I will definitely be back

name: Adam Swedenburg
text: They do really good. You can check in on the app and save time from waiting when you get there. In saying that though they do allow walk in if don't want the app. They also give military, fire, and ems discounts.

name: Dedra Sellers
text:
Waited an hour for a trim. What we did not know, if you get an appointment on their app you can just WALK in at time and those who just "walked-in" get pushed down the list. Unfair in some ways...just do not get bumped because of not being informed like we were.
FYI----make an appt on the app then delete the dang thing until you need it again.
Military also get a discount but they do not advertise it.

name: Christina Tucker
text: I was upset that we couldn't use the coupon on the child haircut. :( However, for the price, my son's hair looked great and stylist was helpful. Great place for a quick, unscheduled haircut.

name: Anastasia Hudson
text: Nice staff, good haircut.

name: Beth Thomas
text: Fast service and love my haircut and style!  Thanks Hannah!!

name: Amy Burleson
text: First time there, friendly and quick service. Love it! My hair is healthy again 💚

name: Michael Rafferty
text: No capes.... pretty sad

name: travis mahaffey
text: Taylor did an awesome job. It's always tricky when you don't live in the area, and don't know where to go. I would definitely recommend going in, and ask for Taylor.

name: Mary Black
text: The staff is always nice. And they do a really good job cutting my husband's hair.

name: Marko Simic
text: Six chairs and one person cutting hair. Name should really be Super(long wait)Cuts.

name: Shane Scheeler
text: Friendly staff and a good haircut

name: Chloediane00
text: I decided to get my hair cut here and immediately after walking in I got a bad vibe. The stylist upfront yelled at the stylist in the back to come do my hair. The entire time my hairstylist was doing my hair her and the other stylist were talking and joking around NOT being professional at all. At one point the other stylist came up behind my hairstylist and said something about what she was doing. My hair stylist replied with “Shut you’re mouth!”. She showed me my hair when she was done and the layers were very choppy. I asked her to blend them and she “did”. I left with uneven choppy layers and my hair being nothing like the picture I showed her. I am going to another hair salon to see if they can fix it.

name: Irvine Montebello-Alvarez
text: Taylor was my stylist and she was great! Did exactly what I wanted! Would definitely return!

name: Qiang Huang
text:
In case the store owner checks review, I get to the point here. The personality and communication skills of Arian do not qualify her a job in service sector. Definitely not a manager, if she is one right now as she self claimed.

I have been going to this place despite of a bad experience 2 years ago with a stylist before. At that time,  I averaged my rating at 2 star. But now, I wish I could give 0 or negative rating, and will not go there anymore despite of the convenient location.

I believe this place can still survive only because its location is very convenient for students. I went there in a morning in March, I was told they didn't take walk in. Understandable in covid. I made an appointment at 2 , then I went back at 1:50, and waited for 40 minutes, and finally sit on the chair at 2:30, and got the 10 minutes hair cut. Then I apparently complained to the stylist that the so called appointment didn't work.

However, I forgot all these, until I was reminded by the same stylist yesterday in May.  When I saw she didn't have mask on yesterday, I asked if she had vaccine.. she said no. Then I asked why she didn't have mask on if she didn't have vaccine. Then, she told me she refused to serve me anymore because I complained last time as well. I didn't even know what is the last time and who she is, then she showed me the ticket, which shows her name ARIAN for my last visit. And told me what happened last time. I wanted to talk to the manager, she self claimed to be the manager while wagging her head and proudly laughing at me.

Okay, she won. I walked out and went to another place and fixed my half done hair.

Isn't it part of managers job to handle customers complaint? I know many of us at our jobs need to pretend to like our boss.  But since when it becomes a responsibility for a customer to pretend to like the service even if they don't? Ok, I have been there for 15 times as the ticket showed.  Out of 15, I do remember 2 bad experiences including yesterday. Plenty of okay and good ones. But this Arian experience ruined all and I don't believe her personality and communication skills qualify her for a job in service sector, not mentioning a manager. I promise I won't go back anymore.

name: Yeshurun Shirel
text: Hours are not updated!!!

I left with highlights that looks like I have had them for 2 months they are over a inch from the scalp plus its orange! I'm disgusted! Not to mention I paid 120 and left with half way dry hair and no style. I will NEVER go back. If I could post pictures I would !

name: Michelle Abner
text: I have had great experiences with my 2 year old and 9 years old boy haircuts. Cuts looked very good.  Price was 12.00 and we were in and out quickly.

name: Leslee Burns
text: Always cut and style just right.

name: Jeri Jernigan
text:
Crystal is a phenomenal beautician! Both friendly and professional. Very affordable!!

We have a family of 6 - 2 males and 4 females. She not only cuts everyone’s hair; she also colors my hair and it’s never turned out any way other than what I’ve requested. She is always patient with all of us indecisive females.

Another thing ( among many ) that I absolutely LOVE about her is that she isn’t one of those beauticians that will take on something that she’s not completely comfortable/confident doing. She will point you to another professional co-worker.

Crystal never makes us feel anything other than confident and beautiful/handsome. We love the work she does and her company as she does it; so much so we have always driven from Huntsville to her.  She’s just amazing.

name: Leslie Roden
text: Stylist Barbara Medlock is the bomb, she's cut all of my boys hair(5 and under) and is very patient and treats them well, and the haircut is always up to date.  She also does mine and I'm super picky, while she is doing the hair she also give you advice on how to treat your hair and what to do and not to do. The Colors she puts in mine always turns out better than expected, and the cut is beyond amazing I have super curly and frizzy hair and she know exactly what needs to be done before I sit in her chair! Her personality is super amazing! Great to talk to while your getting your makeover done!!

name: Autumn Woods
text: I got highlights and a hair cute by Crystal. My hair has never looked so good. She’s super sweet and friendly. She provided asome service in every way she could. I definitely recommend!!!

name: Calethea Martin
text: I use Barbra and she is awesome. I won’t use anyone else to do my hair. I love being able to just run in and get my hair done and get out . They are really friendly and great girls.

name: Melissa Clark
text: Barbara Medlock is a outstanding stylist, she is great with my Two year old I only let her and Jennifer cut mine and my son's hair. They are both amazing. Next time you go ask for Barbara or Jennifer

name: Katrina Adams
text: Went in curly and came out straight! Love the smart styles crew!!

name: Edna Dowdy
text:
I had someone cutting my grandson hair, she is good and works there. Last 3 visits I have been done wrong. I called they said sure you dont need appointment so I went and they had 3 more customers with appointments ahead and could6do that day.
Next time I made appointment  got there and still had to wait greater then 1 hr.
Next time made appointment  and they were taking  people ahead who had appointment at same time
I will never go back.

name: Samantha Jackson
text: Barbra is amazing she always does an outstanding job she is very professional and very sweet. She always makes sure it’s what you want weather it’s color, cut etc. I recommend for everyone to go to smart style in Scottsboro and ask for Barbra you will not be disappointed I promise.

name: Jonathon Roden
text: Barbara done a awesome job cutting my hair. I highly recommend her if you go she does really good and has a great personality.

name: Amanda Frost
text: Brittany has done my hair for many years.  She always makes me feel and look beautiful. She is my favorite! Not only is she welcome, so are the other stylists.  We always laugh together.

name: Whitney Reeves
text: The Ladies and Gentlemen at Smartstyle are friendly. Barbara Medlock always cuts my hair. She does AMAZING. I recommend her. She makes sure that you are satisfied and always has a smile she is Very professional.

name: аварийный монтер Hunter
text: When a cow with a lawnmower haircut meets you at the door and demands your phone number before you are even allowed to get in the barber chair it is time to go to a real barber shop. I cut a better cut than what she allowed someone to do to her head. I don't want your spam. All you needed was my green ... and better customer service skills.

text: Barbara done my hair for my wedding and she done excellent! I wouldn’t let  anyone else touch my hair!

name: Tina Brooks
text: All i wanted was a trim.. I had beautiful long hair with layers.  She just wouldnt stop cutting.. My layers were  all over the place... Had to go somewhere else to get it fixed.. Now i have short hair... Dont go to this place....

resp.text:
Tina, we're sorry to hear this - thank you for letting us know. We strive to provide a quality salon experience every time you visit, and we have shared your experience with our local Guest Service team.

If you are interested in discussing this with a District Leader, please contact 1-800-737-3535 or departmentcs@regiscorp.com.

Thank you,
SmartStyle Guest Services Team

name: Jackey Nix

text: Great place to get a quick cut or trim. They offer hair coloring, perms, and a few things that I am not familiar with (men don't know everything lol.) The employees are always friendly and the service is quick even on a walk in basis. I am unsure if they do appointments, but I would think that they do. They do offer childrens cuts as well. They are not out of sight with their prices for cuts, nut they do carry a relatively expensive lime of hair products.

text: Always get a good hair there...

name: Amy Hammonds

name: paynegang53
text: By far the worst haircut i have ever had in my life. Male haircut, what I asked for was simple, or so I thought, #3 on the sides, make sure you get good around my ears and please get the front straight because i have this huge cowlick on the right side and I stand it all up on the front to hide it. Afterwards she asked if it was fine, I said yes because I can never tell until I get home anyways. Upon arrival to my bathroom mirror, i find that i have 0.5 inch of hair in the front middle, covered by 1.5 inches (like i wanted), 2.5 inches on the right and 1 inch on the left. I have a sink full of hair from around my ears and the back is gaped up all to hell. I almost want to stand in front of the door with my hair all jacked up and tell people that walk in that this is what $15.50 will get you. I am so mad right now that i will never even get a gallon of milk at that place, not an rx, not anything and am going to tell anyone that asked me the same thing. Ridiculous that anyone could pass beauty school with work like that on something so simple. I feel sorry for the females that come in with something more complicated and pay 3 times as much

They will cut your hair however you like from old school cuts to newer looks.  They cut for all ages.

I recommend them to anyone even got my dad and brother to go to them before with no complaints from either.

You want be disappointed.

When I told him is when he found out. The barber that cut his hair didn't have the audacity to tell him that he messed up. That is low down and dirty. I do not recommend this place what so ever. They will mess you up and have you walking around looking crazy and embarrassed.  He has to go to work and everywhere eles with a huge bald spot on his head due to Nu Look. If I could I would give them a zero rating. Go somewhere else before it's too late.
Also, i will add that the first time he went there he had a different guy which did a great job on him. The one who did him tis time should be out of a job.

text:
Hands down, this the worst hair salon experience I’ve ever had.
My hair is natural and I came in for a wash, blow dry, and flat iron. I made an appointment for 1230 and waited nearly 45min to be seen. After my wash, the stylist sat me in a chair with my hair dripping wet and no towel for about 15min while she worked on her other client; her associate noticed and brought me one of her own towels.
Once finished, so much product was in my hair that my hands were greasy after touching my hair. With further inspection, my scalp was not even clean. I’ve had to rewash and do my hair because it was worse than when I came in.

resp.text: So sorry your experience wasn't satisfactory.  I wish I would have known while you were there so I could have made your experience better.

name: Joseph Nelson
text:
Today, everyone was either closed or booked... It was to my benefit though..

I accidentally stumbled upon AZ and luckily she was absolutely the best barber I have personally ever visited! I've seen many from all over the US and the world.

She was not concerned with squeezing in as many as possible; she dedicated about 45 min.  and gave an abnormal amount of attention to details and the blending and edging will go unrivaled not only in this area, but I dare say the entire South East.  I could have almost been deceived into thinking that I was all she had going on for the day.  I am talking about a real deal, professional and I can NOT articulate this enough! She is legit!

I'm still finding their pricing laughable and to a significant degree. I challenge anyone to find a Barber as good at all, let alone for their asking prices. VERY affordable and as a matter of fact cheaper than some of these national chains' "basic" cuts.

Anyone who sits in her chair and walks away with a legitimate complaint is someone who should not be taken serious and has their own personal issues that need to be worked through.

Do yourself a favor, if you haven't tried this shop and/or AZ, you need to consider allocating some time and doing so.  You won't regret it and if you do, see above.

name: Shelby Davis
text:
I *HIGHLY* recommend Chop in Hoover!! It’s a fun environment, it’s clean, and the employees are so friendly and talented. They offer you cold drinks as you wait or while in the chair. They really take care of you there.

My stylist was Hannah, and she was beyond amazing in every aspect. I came in with extremely long, dead, boring hair. I had never dyed it before in my entire 25 years, lol. I decided to finally do it at Chop and was extremely nervous about it. Hannah never missed a beat and talked me through what she thought of my idea with ease. she really soothed my anxiety almost immediately. she kept saying she was excited to do it and I could tell she genuinely was. Her customer service is phenomenal; it felt like I was hanging out with a friend. She cut and colored my hair quickly but carefully, paying attention to little necessary details and explained what she was doing the whole way. She even taught me a thing or two about how dye works since I had never done it before. When she was done, I was blown away. She gave me exactly what I was looking for and more. she gave me a hair style that made me say, “THIS is how I was meant to look. I’ve never felt more ME.”

Thank you, Chop! i’m 100% coming back for all my touch ups and etc.

HANNAH, THANK YOU for everything.

resp.text: Thank you so much Shelby!

text: I scheduled a bald fade with Raul $30. Paid $41 with 10 dollar tip and 1 dollar booking fee. This is one of the worst haircuts I have ever had in my life. I had to go back to get a side fixed and there is literally no fade in my hair. The back of my head looks like a bowl haircut with zero fade and is choppy. This wouldn't be acceptable if it was a 10 dollar haircut, let alone $41. Raul does not know what a bald fade is. Find a new barber. The shop looked great, but I will never be back.

resp.text: We are sorry we did not meet you expectations with this fade.  Please let Brad know when you are ready for your next cut and we can book you for a bald fade gratis.  Total satisfaction is our goal with each client.  We look forward to hearing from you soon! You can reach us at 205-202-4048!

name: DJ Williams
text: Johnny is a great man and barber. He'll try his best to find time to fit you in and make you feel welcome every time. This veteran of both our country and his scissors will always keep the conversation going. The sharpness of his wit is only outmatched by the sharpness of his shears. From the time you walk in to his poster-clad barber shop to walking out the door, you feel every bit masculine. This handlebar mustached man gives everyone the right cut with a handshake and a smile.

name: Josh Altmayer
text: One of the last, true vestiges of the old time "Barber Shop." Johnny is a great guy and has been cutting hair for more than 35 years. True to form, you will find great conversation with racy  jokes, entertaining discussions, and the occasional smoke break. Walk-ins are accepted, but, even if there's a wait, it never seems long before Johnny is able to fit you in. If you call for an appointment and are really lucky, you might be able to persuade him into giving you a hot shave, although he has been doing them less and less. I'll be going here until I'm no longer in need of a barber.

name: Dustin Routzong
text: Brought my son here and we both had a haircut, plus I upgraded with a beard trim. I was not satisfied. I give very specific instructions about how I want my beard. Take care of the flyaways, clean up the sideburns to make a clean line beside the ear, bring the bulk of the beard down 1/4 inch, clean up my established neckline. My beard was around 5 inches in the bulk. It’s now around 2. My necklines were brought up around 1/2 inch and angled. The haircut itself was pretty standard, but as far as barber maintenance with a beard and a true fade, I’ll stick with a black barbershop.

resp.text: I am sorry that your beard trim did not meet your expectations, we strive to make your request as best as possible, however, I do understand sometimes things do not end up working out exactly how we want them. I hope you might reconsider and visit us again so we can meet your wishes.

name: Grant Hershbine
text: I was in Birmingham on a business trip, looking for a simple place to get a haircut. The service that I received at The Barber Bar was far beyond what I could have ever expected! Tara did an amazing job cutting, grooming, and styling my hair! I am so hoping that these awesome ladies come to Huntsville soon!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Grant! We are so happy that you chose us while you were in town!

name: Michael Crenshaw
text: These ladies really know how to give a great cut!    Mandy cut my hair and she is the best.   The shampoo chairs are really comfortable.  And the cold beer to enjoy topped it off.  Best barber shop I’ve ever been.

resp.text: We are so glad that you enjoyed your time here! Thank you so much for leaving us a review! Cant wait to have you back!

name: Jonathan Seufert
text: I had my hair cut and beard trimmed  by Rachel who did a phenomenal job. I gave her a vague description of what I wanted and she absolutely went above and beyond. My son also had his hair cut and it was the single best hair cut experience of his life. They are professional and know what to do for every situation.

resp.text: Thank you for the fabulous review Jonathan!

name: Katherine O'Neal Gilbert
text: April is amazing. My husband has been searching for a barber for two years and finally found this ray of sunshine. He always looks amazing after April cuts his hair. We even send our son there too!! If you do not pick her, you are missing out!!

resp.text: So happy you chose us as your new salon home! Thanks for coming in guys!

name: Veilside
text:
The Barber Bar is the place to be! From a full service to a stand alone cut, these barbers are accurate and affordable! Not only will you be warmly welcomed and directed to some very relaxing amenities, but you'll be laughing so much you might even forget about your hair being cut! April is amazing and very thorough, both with her sheers and her choice in fellow barbers. They deliver excellence and exactly what you pay for; you will not be disappointed!

My first time with the Signature Cut:

resp.text: Thank you we hope to see you again!

name: Diverse Productions - Cinematic Videography
text: Mandy did a wonderful job at cutting my hair and gave me the best fade possible! I have no complaints about this place at all environment was very openly and cool! Will be a regular here from now on!

resp.text: Thank you so much! We are so glad to be your new Barber Family!

name: Jared Godwin
text:
Great barber! I’ve tried many local barbers in town since moving here, and I’m very impressed with the Barber Bar!
They have plenty of services, but I always like getting a straight blade beck shave (hard to find in Birmingham), and they did very well!
Great location, friendly staff, and most importantly an impressive haircut. 5/5

resp.text: Thank you so much Jared!

resp.text: We are so happy you enjoyed your experience! Thanks for coming in, hope to see you soon!

text: Several barbers work here, some for 30+ years. They have special needs helpers in the shop and they're all so sweet, gentle, and kind. JJ is adorable!!! There's a stylist named Jan in the back for women and she's excellent, very knowledgeable and experienced. She's got a long waiting list so keep that in mind. Waylon trimmed my 5 year old granddaughter's hair and she loves him. I see men walk out with great looking haircuts, too. Totally awesome place! Cash only, no cards or checks. Bring tip money too, they definitely deserve it!

The barber took his time and made sure I was happy with the end results. Needless to say, I am extremely happy, and what's ultimately more important, my wife is happy with it. This will definitely be the place I go to from now on for beard trims and hair cuts!

text: My first few haircuts after moving to Gadsden, AL were fairly solid. Unfortunately, the last couple cuts I’ve gotten have been less than stellar. My old barber where I used to live laughed when I went in for her to fix it after already paying $20 after a tip. This time, when he made the same mistake — left so much hair near the top and gave me pretty much a bowl cut, I asked him to take more off, that is was too long, he told me no and then that was the end of the cut. Going to have to look elsewhere.

name: Ryan Beverly
text: So after my barber of 3 years moved I needed a place where they would take car of my hair and my ridiculously thick beard. Having only had my hair touched by one person in that time I was recommended this place by a couple of friends. So I decided to give it a try and glad I did, while hesitant at first I was told to go see Charlene. We introduced ourselves and made me feel a little more at ease.  This shop has been around since 1952 and you can sense the essence of that in this barber shop. I told her how I wanted my hair and she went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable and tell me what she was gonna do every step of the way. Definitely like the fact of the old school barber shop as I've never really had a hot towel service. Charlene made me feel comfortable and the haircut and beard trim look great. I'm happy about the recommendation and plan on going back. Go see her!

name: David Hall
text:
I asked for a no guard clipper on my head and a 3 guard on my facial hair. Instead of using regular clippers on my hair, she used trimmers and pulled my hair several times trying to go too fast. No apologies. Very unprofessional.

When she trimmed my facial hair, she used a 3 guard on my beard. She went too fast and left long pieces. When I pointed it out, she didn’t fix it. She didn’t even bother trimming below my lower lip. She removed the cape and I had to remind her to cut my mustache. She cut half of my mustache, cut one side of my lip all the way down to the skin when she slipped trimming it. On my beard, she gapped it on my neck and instead of saying anything about it, proceeded to cut that section higher than the other side leaving my beard crooked. When I left, I had to immediately go home and try to fix my beard.

After all that, she still proceeded to charge me $25.

I have never been treated so unprofessionally and carelessly.

text: These are the best stylists in a twenty mile radius, that I know of, or farther. The fact that they are in Walmart does not discredit their talent and artistic gift. There are many requests for specific stylists but give the others a chance. It is their priority to please you and they never rush to the point of just barely meeting the requirements. The newer stylists are always doing their very best to please you and they work as a team if one employee needs help. You can take before and after pictures, create new color ideas, highlight, shadow root melt, ombre, all over colors, perms, stack bob haircuts, undercut fades, layers, color correction, beautiful bangs, waxed eyebrows, a head massaging shampoo and conditioner, great products, and more. name: Kristin Turri
text: I went to a lot of salons when I lived in Nashville and none of them hold a candle to the talent and skill the people have here in Huntsville at The Masters. Bret is the color expert in this city. He and evey hairdresser there are always on the cutting edge. The people at the masters know hair and do it right and with class. It's a top notch salon and we are lucky to have them here making the city beautiful. The receptionists are also fantastic.

resp.text:
Kristen,
Our team is so happy to continue serving you and so grateful for your feedback! We strive to create an atmosphere where our guests can feel comfortable getting to know our full team of stylists while receiving an expert level of care and service, and it makes us so happy to know that it shows from front desk to service provider! Thank you so much for helping make us the team that we are.
- The Masters Team

name: Brittaney Baker
text:
I have been going to this salon for years, and I used to love it. I lived out of state for school, and would plan my visits around when I could come to The Masters. Even now, with me living in Nashville, I would schedule well in advance to make a trip to this salon so I could see my favorite hair stylist, Rita. As someone with curly hair, it takes me a long time to find someone who has the skillset to work with curl patterns. I have had many bad haircuts in my life—anyone with curly hair can relate. Rita changed the way I worked with and styled my hair. I even recommended for my mother to start visiting the salon because I wanted to refer her to Rita. Recently, Rita told us she was moving out of state and that she would be referring all of her clients to Kimberly. I trusted the salon, and so I scheduled my next appointment.

Kimberly has a great disposition. I explained I didn’t want to deviate from the shape that Rita had left, and I only wanted it a little shorter because I knew I wouldn’t be able to be back for a long time. Kimberly asked me if I wanted for her to cut my hair either dry or wet, because “curly haired girls always have a preference”. I told her I would be okay with what she was most comfortable with, and she decided to cut my hair wet. I noticed she was cutting it in large chunks and not taking her time. When she was finished, she asked me how much product I wanted in my hair because “curly haired girls are particular.” After she put it in, she separated my hair into clips and said she was finished while she pulled out the diffuser. As she plugged it in, she looked at me and said: “Do you want to diffuse it yourself? Curly haired girls usually like to do this part themselves.” I was taken aback because this has never been asked of me before—especially by a place that charges almost $100 for a cut. I told Kimberly that, sure, I could diffuse my hair myself. After I was finished, I looked at the result. The hair fell like a triangle; she easily had cut off 4 inches. I quickly paid and went to my car. I decided that I couldn’t leave a place that charged so much to do a substandard job. I pulled up a picture of my hair after I received my last cut, and went back to the salon to see if it could be fixed. When I came back and showed Kimberly the picture, she was apologetic. I sat back down in her chair, and she proceeded to ask me to tell her where I thought she should cut my hair to make it look right. If I could cut my hair myself, I would. But I cannot, and that is why I spend more than $20 to go to a place that emphasizes professionalism and a higher skillset of stylist. Seeing that I was just going to have to leave with a bad haircut, I left.

I called management to ask for a refund. My mother had given me a $50 gift card and I had put the rest on my credit card. They told me the owner was out of town and that they couldn’t refund my money without his saying that it was okay. Instead, they offered me two haircuts. I explained that, although I appreciated this gesture, I wouldn’t be returning to the salon to get my hair cut again. They insisted that it would be okay and that I should go to the stylist who trained both Kimberly and Rita in cutting curly hair. When I declined, they said they would try to talk to the owner. A couple of days later, they returned my phone call to say they had not heard from the owner and they still suggested I take the original offer. I had no plans on going back, but my mother has straight hair and usually has no problems when it comes to getting it trimmed. I asked if I could transfer my two cuts to my mother, seeing as she had purchased the gift card and it was also her money wasted on a bad cut. I would feel better knowing that she could do something nice for herself. But, they said no. I never heard back.

I had to write this for all of the curly haired girls out there who “are particular” or who have a “preference.” Do not come to this salon.

resp.text: Hello Brittany, first off if this was to happen to one of us or a member of our own family, we would not be happy. The team at The Masters are very concerned over your obvious traumatic experience with us. We dropped the ball and failed you. Since this service happened some months ago, we know that the opportunity has passed us by to be able to correct the issue, but we absolutely will do whatever it takes to rectify this situation. We would really love to speak with you to see what we need to do to conquer any future failures such as the one you experienced. Sincerely, Brett Pierce at The Masters.

text: I wouldn't trust my hair to anyone but the professionals at The Masters. I have been a customer for 4 years and have never been disappointed.  Customer satisfaction is always their number one concern!

They all made me feel so special and it's not one of those gossipy salons.  I also watched everyone else in the mirrors and I think all of them were doing a great job. Very professional  !  They definitely know how to treat a customer and make them feel at ease.   It's an hour away from me but I'll never go anywhere else  !!!  The owner was there for a little while and when he left, none of their attitudes changed.  WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE  !!!
